Once in a lifetimeAssistance on purchase of two stroke/four stroke IBM/OBM	A maximum assistance of ₹60,000/- is given as per 50% of the unit cost of ₹1,20,000/-.	5 YearsAssistance on purchase of polypropylene rope for fishing boats	25% of the unit cost of ₹1,50,000/- or 25% of actual expenditure up to a maximum of ₹37,500/-	2 yearsJumbo Plastic Crate and Manual Handling for Marine Fishing Boats	1. Estimated price of jumbo plastic crate is ₹700/- per unit. 40 per cent of the unit cost of ₹700/- or 40 per cent of the actual cost for a fisherman beneficiary on purchase of 50 units per trawler boat gill netter and bucket netter and 50 units per deep-sea boat and 25 units per small boat. Maximum ₹280/- and for SC/ST/Females 60% of unit cost ₹700/- or 60% of actual expenditure maximum ₹420/- is given. 2) Estimated cost of material manually handling stacker is ₹1,50,000/- per unit. A general fisherman beneficiary will be assisted on purchase of 1 unit per trawler boat gill netter and bucket netter and deep-sea boat at a unit cost of ₹1,50,000/- per trawler boat gill netter and bucket netter and deep-sea boat. 60% of the unit cost of ₹1,50,000/- or 60% of the actual cost up to a maximum of ₹9,000/- is given on the purchase of 1 unit.3 yearsSupply of electric equipment to fishermen	Unit cost ₹15,000/- maximum or purchase price whichever is less Support and equipment for FRP boats. Assistance is provided for Solar Electric Lantern ₹3,500/- or purchase price whichever is less	5 YearsAssistance to fishing boats for hygienic toilets	Assistance is given on its unit cost of ₹15,000/- up to a maximum of ₹10,000/- or the actual expenditure incurred whichever is lower.	5 YearsAssistance on purchase of sea cage culture	75 percent of the estimated cost of the unit at ₹6,25,000/- lakh or purchase price whichever is lower (maximum ₹4,68,750/-) is eligible for assistance	Once in a lifetime﻿
eligibility: The applicant must be a native of Gujarat.The applicant must own a registered fishing boat under Real Craft Software (registration is mandatory).The applicant must possess a valid fishing license.The applicant must have a bank account in their name.The applicant must have obtained in-principle approval to purchase of the floor plan.Note: The assistance for infrastructure (cold storage, fish market) is available to private units, entrepreneurs, and fisheries cooperatives.
application_process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.
documents_required: Identity Proof (Aadhaar Card, Voter ID).Residence Proof (Domicile Certificate, Ration Card).Bank Account Details (Passbook or Statement).Fishing License.Boat Registration Certificate (Real Craft software registered).Purchase Invoice (for equipment or infrastructure).Any other document if required.﻿
frequently_asked_questions:
What is the objective of this scheme?The scheme aims to support fishermen by providing financial assistance for purchasing essential fishing equipment, life-saving gear, and infrastructure to enhance safety, efficiency, and fish preservation.Who is eligible to apply for the Providing Navigational Aids and Other Infrastructure Facilities scheme?Any fisherman who is a resident of Gujarat, owns a registered fishing boat under Real Craft software, and holds a valid fishing license is eligible to apply.


What financial assistance is provided to the families of fishermen captured in Pakistan?The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹300/- per day per article to the families of fishermen captured in Pakistan.


Can an applicant avail multiple benefits under this scheme?Yes, an applicant can avail multiple benefits, but some components have time restrictions, such as once in a lifetime or every 2 to 5 years.


What is the maximum subsidy provided for purchasing a GPS device for a fishing boat?The scheme provides a 50% subsidy on the purchase price of a GPS device, with a maximum assistance of ₹20,000/-, whichever is lower.


Does the scheme provide any support for fish storage and refrigeration?Yes, the scheme offers subsidies for deep freezers, refrigerator vans, ice plants, and cold storage facilities to help fishermen preserve their fish for a longer period.


What is the maximum assistance provided for setting up a fish processing plant?The scheme provides financial assistance of up to ₹500 lakh or 50% of the actual cost, whichever is lower, for setting up fish processing plants.


What is the subsidy amount for purchasing a sea cage culture unit?The scheme provides a 75% subsidy on the estimated cost of a sea cage culture unit, up to a maximum of ₹4,68,750/-.


Can a fisherman apply for assistance if their boat is not registered under Real Craft software?No, only fishermen whose boats are registered under Real Craft software are eligible for the scheme's benefits.


What kind of safety equipment is covered under this scheme?The scheme provides financial assistance for life-saving equipment, life buoy rings, and hygienic toilets on fishing boats to enhance safety at sea.


How can an applicant apply for this scheme?An applicant can apply online through the iKhedut portal by completing the registration process and submitting the required documents.

title: Assistance in Packing Materials under Post Harvest Management of Horticultural Produce
details: The scheme "Assistance in Packing Materials under Post Harvest Management of Horticultural Produce" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat,  aims to support farmers by providing financial aid for packing materials used in post-harvest stages to maintain quality and reduce losses.
benefits: Unit Cost: ₹10,000/ha. 75% of the cost or ₹7,500/hectare, whichever is less.﻿Note:Corrugated boxes, wooden boxes will be used as packing material.Assistance will be available up to a maximum limit of 1 hectare per account. Available on i-Khedut portal every year (once during the year),
eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.The applicant should be engaged in horticultural cultivation.
application_process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.
documents_required: 7/12 Certificate.Aadhaar Card.Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the objective of the "Assistance in Packing Materials under Post Harvest Management of Horticultural Produce" scheme?The "Assistance in Packing Materials under Post Harvest Management of Horticultural Produce" scheme aims to support farmers by providing financial aid for packing materials used in post-harvest stages to maintain quality and reduce losses. Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?Any farmer residing in Gujarat and engaged in horticultural cultivation is eligible to apply for this scheme.﻿﻿What is the amount of financial assistance provided under the scheme?The scheme offers financial assistance of 75% of the unit cost or ₹7,500 per hectare, whichever amount is lower.﻿﻿What is the maximum area for which assistance can be claimed?Assistance can be claimed for a maximum of 1 hectare per farmer account per year.﻿﻿What is the unit cost considered by the scheme?The scheme considers a unit cost of ₹10,000/- per hectare for the purpose of calculating assistance.﻿﻿Which types of packing materials are covered under the scheme?The scheme provides support for packing materials such as corrugated boxes and wooden boxes used in the post-harvest handling of horticultural produce.﻿﻿Is the scheme available every year?Yes, the scheme is offered once every year and can be availed annually through the i-Khedut portal.﻿﻿Is there any income limit set for eligibility under this scheme?No, there is no personal or family income limit prescribed for applying to this scheme.﻿﻿How is the assistance amount disbursed to the applicant?The approved assistance amount is typically transferred directly to the applicant’s registered bank account.﻿﻿Where should a farmer apply for the scheme?Applicants can apply on the iKhedut portal to avail the benefits of the scheme.What documents are required to apply for this scheme?The required documents include an Aadhaar card, a 7/12 land record, and either a bank passbook or a cancelled cheque.﻿﻿Who should the applicant contact for help or more information about the scheme?The applicant should contact the nearest agriculture office or visit the iKhedut portal for more information.

title: Assistance Program for Planting in Floriculture
details: The scheme "Assistance Program for Planting in Floriculture" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to encourage floriculture in Gujarat by offering financial support to farmers cultivating various types of flowers. The assistance amount varies depending on the type of flower and whether the farmer is classified as a small/marginal or other category.
benefits: Loose Flowers:₹16,000 per hectare or 40% of cost for small/ marginal farmers.₹10,000 per hectare or 25% of cost for other farmers.﻿Stem (Cut) Flowers:₹40,000 per hectare or 40% of cost for small/ marginal farmers.₹25,000 per hectare or 25% of cost for other farmers.﻿Tuberous Flowers:₹60,000/- per hectare or 40% of cost for small/ marginal farmers.₹37,500/- per hectare or 25% of cost for other farmers.
eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.The applicant must be engaged in floriculture farming (loose, cut, or tuberous flowers).
application_process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.
documents_required: Aadhaar card.Vehicle purchase invoice.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the objective of the "Assistance Program for Planting in Floriculture" scheme?The scheme aims to offer financial assistance to farmers in Gujarat for the cultivation of floriculture crops, including loose, cut, and tuberous flowers, based on crop type and farmer category.﻿﻿Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?Farmers who are engaged in floriculture cultivation are eligible to apply for the scheme.﻿﻿Which types of flowers are covered under this scheme?The scheme provides financial assistance for the cultivation of loose flowers, stem (cut) flowers, and tuberous flowers.﻿﻿What is the maximum financial assistance provided under the scheme?Depending on the category of the farmer and the type of flower cultivated, the assistance ranges from ₹10,000/- to ₹60,000/- per hectare.﻿﻿Is there any income limit for farmers to apply under this scheme?No, there is no income limit for individual or family income to be eligible for this scheme.How can an applicant apply for this scheme?Applicants can apply on the iKhedut portal to avail the benefits of the scheme.What documents are required to apply for the scheme?Applicants are required to submit an Aadhaar card and Vehicle purchase invoice..Who should the applicant contact for help or more information about the scheme?The applicant should contact the nearest agriculture office or visit the iKhedut portal for more information.Can farmers belonging to any caste or social group apply for this scheme?Yes, the scheme is open to all farmers, regardless of caste, category, or social group.﻿﻿

title: Atma Nirbhar Plantation Yojana
details: The scheme "Atma Nirbhar Plantation Yojana (ANPY)" was launched by the Department of Agriculture, Government of Arunachal Pradesh, aims to promote self-reliance in the agriculture sector through sustainable plantation activities across the state's diverse agro-climatic zones. Under this scheme, support in the form of plantation assistance and allied resources is provided to individual farmers, Self-Help Groups (SHGs), and Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs).
benefits: Access to plantation support including technical guidance, planting material, and financial assistance.
eligibility: The Scheme can be applied by individual farmers as well as Self-Help Groups (SHGs)/ Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs).Eligibility Criteria for Individual FarmersThe applicant should be a native of Arunachal Pradesh.The applicant should be an individual farmer. The applicant should have landholding between 0.50 hectares and 25 hectares.The applicant should not be a bank defaulter.The applicant should not be a government servant.Eligibility Criteria for Self-Help Groups (SHGs)The applicant should be a Self-Help Group (SHG) based in Arunachal Pradesh. The SHG should have a minimum of 1.0 hectare and up to 50 hectares of land.The SHG should not be a bank defaulter.An already existing SHGs prior to involvement of SrLM shall be considered.SHGs formed for small-scale industries such as weaving, knitting, tailoring, and other similar businesses shall not be entertained or considered eligible.Note: The SHGs formed especially for Agri- sector shall be given priority.Eligibility Criteria for Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs)The Farmer Producer Organization (FPO) should be registered in Arunachal Pradesh. The FPO should have a minimum of 5 hectares and a maximum of 50 hectares of land.The FPO should have at least 100 shareholders.The FPO should submit at least one audited Balance Sheet.All board members and shareholders of FPO should be non-defaulters to any bank/financial institution.All types of FPOs engaged in agriculture business will get benefit from this programme.
application_process: OnlineOfflineInterested and eligible students need to apply online on the Atma Nirbhar Yojana portal. New User RegistrationSelect the "Login" option.Subsequently, click on the "Register Here" link.Complete the registration form with the requisite details, including your name, Aadhaar card number, email ID, and mobile number.Establish a password for your account.Upon successful registration, the applicant will receive a User ID and password.Login & Application Process:﻿Log in using the provided User ID and password to access the application form.Fill in the complete application form.Upload the required documents, including a photograph, caste certificate, residential certificate, and land ownership proof, etc.Submit the application form.
documents_required: Passport-size PhotographAadhaar CardPAN CardST CertificateDomicile Certificate/Permanent Resident Certificate (PRC)SHG/FPO Document Proof of Land Ownership Document (LPC/ any Land Documents duly Certified by HGB/GB/PRI and countersigned by the local administration)Certified Copy of the Sketch MapPhotocopy of 1st page of Bank Passbook One audited Balance Sheet (For FPO)Any Other Document if Required
frequently_asked_questions: Who are the eligible beneficiaries under scheme?Eligible beneficiaries include:Individual farmersSelf-Help Groups (SHGs)Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs)What is the minimum and maximum land area required to apply?Individual Farmers: Minimum 0.50 hectare; Maximum 25 hectares.SHGs: Minimum 1.0 hectare; Maximum 50 hectares.FPOs: Minimum 5 hectares; Maximum 50 hectares.Are there any restrictions on the type of SHGs that can apply?Yes. SHGs formed specifically for agricultural activities are eligible. SHGs established for small-scale industries like weaving, knitting, tailoring, or other non-agricultural businesses are not qualified for this scheme.Are government employees eligible to apply for ANPY?No. Government servants are not eligible to apply for this scheme.Can bank defaulters apply for the scheme?No. Individuals or entities with a history of bank defaults are not eligible for ANPY.What are the eligibility criteria for FPOs under scheme?FPOs must:Be registered entities.Have at least one audited balance sheet.Ensure all board members and shareholders are non-defaulters.Have a minimum of 100 shareholders.How can one apply for the ANPY scheme?Interested applicants should visit the District Agriculture Office in their respective districts for application details and submission.Is there an online application process for ANPY?Yes. Applicants can register and apply online through the official Atma Nirbhar Yojana portal of Arunachal Pradesh. Can existing SHGs formed before the involvement of SrLM apply?Yes. SHGs that were established prior to the involvement of the State Rural Livelihoods Mission (SrLM) are eligible to apply.
sources_and_references:
Scheme Details: https://lohit.nic.in/scheme/atma-nirbhar-plantation-yojana-anpy/
Application Form: https://cdn.s3waas.gov.in/s3c0c7c76d30bd3dcaefc96f40275bdc0a/uploads/2023/05/2023051921.pdf
Application Portal: https://agri.arunachal.gov.in/atmanirbhar_yojana/user-register

title: PMMSY: Ice Plant/Cold Store of Minimum 30-Ton Capacity - Haryana
details: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Ice Plant/Cold Store of minimum 30-ton capacity, introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide the subsidy to support the establishment of ice plants or cold storage facilities with a minimum capacity of 30 tons to strengthen fish preservation and cold chain infrastructure in Haryana.This centrally sponsored scheme is jointly funded 50% by the Central Government and 50% by the State Government. Beneficiaries must submit an undertaking in their DPR/SCP to keep the unit operational, bear all post-construction costs, and ensure ice is supplied to fishers and fish farmers at affordable prices.﻿
benefits: The project cost is ₹120,00,000/-Subsidy Distribution :A 40% subsidy is available for the General Category.A 60% subsidy is offered for SC (Scheduled Caste) and Women beneficiaries.
eligibility: The applicant must be a resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).The applicant must submit an undertaking in the DPR/SCP to bear all operational, maintenance, and post-construction management costs, and to ensure the continuous operation of the ice plant/cold storage.The applicant must note that central assistance will be provided based on the actual cost, within the overall ceiling specified under the relevant PMMSY sub-components.The applicant must ensure that the ice produced is supplied to fishers and fish farmers at an affordable price.The applicant must either own the project land or hold it on a long-term registered lease of at least 10 years to be eligible.
application_process: OnlineOnline - via CSCsRegistration Process on Antyodaya-SARAL Portal:Step 1: Visit the Official Portal: Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.﻿Step 2: For registration, click on “New User/Register Here” and fill in all the mandatory details i.e. Name, Email ID, Mobile Number & password. Click on ‘Submit’.Step 3: Verify the OTP received in the provided Email and Mobile Number. Alternatively, click on the Verification Link to activate the profile.Login to Apply for the Scheme:Step 1: Visit the Official Portal: Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.﻿Step 2: The “Sign in here” option is available on the right side of the screen. Fill in the required credentials and click on the ‘Login’ button.Step 3: In the opened window, click on “Scheme/Services list”, and a list of schemes will appear on the screen.Step 4: Now, select the scheme and click on “Apply for Service/Scheme”.Step 5: Fill in all the details in the online application form and click on "Submit".﻿Track Your Service Online:Track Application/Appeal: Click here.Track Ticket: Click here.﻿Track Your Service Through SMS:Registered Mobile Number: Type SARAL and send to 9954699899 to track your application.Other Mobile Number: Type SARAL<space><Application ID/Ticket No.> and send to 9954699899 to track your application/ticket.﻿Contact Us:Helpline: 0172-3968400Email: saral.haryana@gov.in﻿Note: Govt. Charges: No FeeService Charges:   ₹10/-Atal Seva Kendra Service Charges:  ₹10/-﻿
documents_required: Date of Birth Certificate (Voter ID/Birth Certificate/Aadhaar/Matriculation Certificate)Caste Certificate from First Class Magistrate (Tehsildar/SDM)Agreement Deed between beneficiary and Fisheries DepartmentTraining Certificate related to the operation/maintenance of cold storageLand Record from Tehsil (Jamabandi, Nakal Akshizra, Fard, Registered Patta Nama) with clear title and latest recordsGST BillsPhotographs of Cold Storage with beneficiaryDetail of Bank Account and PAN CardDetailed Project Report (DPR) or Self-Contained Proposal (SCP) as per PMMSY guidelinesAll bills above ₹50,000 as per E-way/Income Tax/GST rulesCertificate from C.A. with the bills certifying payment compliance with Income Tax/GST rulesCLU/NOC/Pollution/Fire Certificate from concerned departmentNOC from Gram Sabha/Municipal Corporation/Authority of the area where the unit is locatedClear Site Plan/Area Site Plan attached with subsidy caseAll documents should be in readable form
frequently_asked_questions: How can I apply for the Ice Plant/Cold Storage subsidy under PMMSY?To apply, you must have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) and submit a Detailed Project Report (DPR) or Self-Contained Proposal (SCP) along with all required documents through Antyodaya-SARAL.Is it necessary to own land to be eligible for this scheme?No, land on long-term registered lease is also acceptable, provided the lease is for a minimum of 10 years and has a clear title.Is there any specific requirement regarding the price of ice sold from the plant?Yes, you must ensure that the ice produced is supplied to fishers and fish farmers at an affordable price.What is the time limit for getting a response after applying?The Right to Service (RTS) time limit is 50 days from the date of application submission.What type of agreement needs to be submitted with the application?An agreement deed must be submitted between the beneficiary and the Fisheries Department as part of the required documentation.Is any training certificate required for applying?Yes, you must submit a training certificate related to the operation and maintenance of cold storage facilities.What kind of photographs do I need to submit?You must submit photographs of the cold storage along with yourself (the beneficiary) in the frame.What is the service fee?No Govt fee; Rs. 10 Service Charge; Rs. 10 Atal Seva Kendra Service Charge.Do all documents need to be in any specific format?Yes, all documents submitted must be in readable form to be considered valid for the subsidy case.What email or helpline can I contact for further assistance?You can contact the helpline at 0172-3968400 or email saral.haryana@gov.in for any queries related to the application.

title: PMMSY: Inputs for fresh water Aquaculture including Composite fish culture, Scampi, Pangasius, Tilapia etc - Haryana
details: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Inputs for fresh water Aquaculture, including Composite fish culture, Scampi, Pangasius, Tilapia, etc, introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to expand fisheries production in Haryana. This centrally sponsored scheme is jointly funded 50% by the Central Government and 50% by the State Government. It provides input cost subsidies for the first crop in newly constructed ponds under PMMSY, aiming to promote aquaculture in urban and semi-urban areas.﻿
benefits: The project cost is: 4,00,000/- per hectareSubsidy Distribution:40% of the project cost for General Category beneficiaries60% of the project cost for SC/Women beneficiaries
eligibility: The applicant must be a resident of Haryana with a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).The applicant will be eligible for input cost subsidy provided by the State Government only for the expansion of fisheries in urban or semi-urban areas under the construction of new ponds.The applicant will receive central financial assistance only for the initial fish crop (fertilizer) in newly constructed ponds.The applicant will be eligible for central financial assistance on input costs only if the pond is properly prepared for fisheries.The applicant may use land on a long-term registered lease, provided the lease period is at least 7 years, for eligibility under this scheme.
application_process: OnlineOnline - via CSCsRegistration Process on Antyodaya-SARAL Portal:Step 1: Visit the Official Portal: Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.﻿Step 2: For registration, click on “New User/Register Here” and fill in all the mandatory details,i.e., Name, Email ID, Mobile Number & password. Click on ‘Submit’.Step 3: Verify the OTP received in the provided Email and Mobile Number. Alternatively, click on the Verification Link to activate the profile.﻿Login to Apply for the Scheme:Step 1: Visit the Official Portal: Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.﻿Step 2: The “Sign in here” option is available on the right side of the screen. Fill in the required credentials and click on the ‘Login’ button.Step 3: In the opened window, click on “Scheme/Services list”, and a list of schemes will appear on the screen.Step 4: Now, select the scheme and click on “Apply for Service/Scheme”.Step 5: Fill in all the details in the online application form and click on "Submit".﻿Track Your Service Online:Track Application/Appeal: Click here.Track Ticket: Click here.﻿Track Your Service Through SMS:Registered Mobile Number: Type 'SARAL' and send it to 9954699899 to track your application.Other Mobile Number: Type SARAL<space><Application ID/Ticket No.> and send to 9954699899 to track your application/ticket.﻿Contact Us:Helpline: 0172-3968400Email: saral.haryana@gov.in﻿Note: Govt. Charges: No FeeService Charges:   ₹10/-Atal Seva Kendra Service Charges:  ₹10/-﻿
documents_required: Agreement Deed between beneficiary and Fisheries Department.Date of Birth Certificate (Voter ID/Birth Certificate/Aadhaar/Matriculation Certificate).Caste Certificate from First Class Magistrate (Tehsildar).Training Certificate of beneficiary.Land Record from Tehsil (Own Land - Jamabandi, Nakal Akshizra, Farad) or registered lease deed of minimum 7 years.Bills/Receipts/Vouchers.Photographs of inputs with beneficiary.Detail of Bank Account and PAN Card.Detailed Project Report (DPR)/Self Contained Proposal (SCP) as per PMMSY guidelines.﻿
frequently_asked_questions: Who can apply for the subsidy under the freshwater aquaculture scheme?Any beneficiary who possesses a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) is eligible to apply under the scheme.What kind of ponds are eligible for input cost assistance?Only newly constructed ponds with a long-term usage duration and a registered lease period of at least 7 years are eligible.Is financial assistance provided for existing ponds?No, assistance is provided only for the initial fish crop in newly constructed ponds, not for existing or previously used ponds.How much subsidy can a general category applicant receive?General category beneficiaries are eligible for a subsidy of 40% of the total project cost.Is it necessary to submit a DPR or proposal while applying?Yes, a Detailed Project Report (DPR) or Self-Contained Proposal (SCP) must be submitted according to PMMSY guidelines.What kind of training certificate is required for the application?A valid training certificate related to fisheries from an approved source is required at the time of application.Is it required to submit photographs with the inputs?Yes, photographs of the inputs along with the beneficiary in the frame must be submitted.What is the time limit for processing the application?The application must be processed within 50 days as per the Right to Service (RTS) time limit.Can I apply for assistance for semi-urban pond construction?Yes, subsidies are available for fisheries expansion in urban and semi-urban areas through new pond construction.Where can I get help or submit queries regarding my application?You can reach out to saral.haryana@gov.in or call the helpline at 0172-3968400 for assistance.

title: Assistance of Concentrate Feed for Pregnant Animals (Scheduled Tribe Category)
details: The scheme "Assistance of Concentrate Feed for Pregnant Animals (Scheduled Caste Category)" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support Scheduled Tribe livestock owners during the last trimester of cattle pregnancy—a critical period for both the animal and the calf. Through this scheme, 150 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed is provided free of cost to eligible beneficiaries to enhance milk yield, extend the milking period, and prevent health complications.
benefits: Name of ComponentStandard of assistanceRemarksMinimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming BenefitsConcentrate Feed 250 kg BIS type II Concentrate feed per beneficiary100% assistanceEvery year
eligibility: The applicant must be a livestock owner.The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe Category.The animal/ cattle should be in the last trimester of pregnancy.
application_process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Animal Husbandry Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.Note: Required Documents can also be submitted in hard copies to the office mentioned in the application form within 7 days.
documents_required: Barcoded ration card.Government approved photo ID (Aadhaar, Voter ID, etc.).Certificate of natural breeding or artificial insemination of the animal.Animal pregnancy diagnosis certificate.Disability certificate from a competent authority (only if the applicant is disabled).Caste Certificate.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the main purpose of the 'Assistance of Concentrate Feed for Pregnant Animals (Scheduled Tribe Category)' scheme?The scheme is designed to provide nutritional support to pregnant animals during their last trimester to improve their health, enhance immunity, prevent metabolic diseases, and increase milk production.Who is eligible to benefit from this scheme?Livestock owners who belong to the Scheduled Tribe Category are eligible to receive assistance under this scheme.What type and quantity of feed is provided under the scheme?Under the scheme, each eligible beneficiary receives 250 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed free of cost.How often can a beneficiary receive the feed assistance?The assistance can be claimed once every year by eligible livestock owners.Does the beneficiary have to pay anything for the concentrate feed?No, the concentrate feed is provided as 100% assistance, and the beneficiary does not have to bear any cost.What is BIS Type II concentrate feed?BIS Type II concentrate feed is a balanced, high-quality nutritional supplement approved by the Bureau of Indian Standards, suitable for pregnant animals.Can the same livestock owner apply again next year?Yes, the benefit can be availed once every year by the same eligible livestock owner.How can a livestock owner apply for the scheme?A livestock owner can apply by completing an online registration on the iKhedut portal.

title: State Fisheries Input Scheme
details: The scheme "State Fisheries Input Scheme" was launched by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to fish farmers in the form of input subsidies to enhance productivity and sustainability in fish farming. Under this scheme, fish farmers who are already engaged in fish farming are provided a 50% subsidy on fish feed, medicines, and essential input materials such as hand nets, hapa, nets, mini kits, etc.
benefits: Tangible Benefits:50% Subsidy on Fish Farming Inputs:Subsidy on the market value of fish feed, medicines, hatchnets, hapas, nets, and minikits.Fish Feed Subsidy Allocation Based on Pond Size:1 quintal feed for 100 sq. meter pond.6 quintals feed for 500 to 2,000 sq. meter pond.7 quintals feed for R.A.S./Bio floc units.10 quintals feed for Trout farming units.Input Material Subsidy:50% subsidy on market cost of handnet, hapa, net, and minikit.Limited to 1 unit per item per fish farmer.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should be currently engaged in fish farming.The applicant should belong to any caste categories including general, scheduled caste, scheduled tribe, other backward classes, women, etc.The applicant should own or operate a pond or aquaculture unit (Biofloc, RRS, Trout farm, etc.) within the state.
application_process: OfflineOnlineApplication Process:Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) in the office of the Assistant Director of Fisheries/District Fisheries In-charge at the district level and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents in the office of the Assistant Director of Fisheries/District Fisheries In-charge.Post-application Process:Step 1: The fisheries inspector or field officer conducts a survey to verify the pond and prepares a detailed proposal in consultation with the beneficiary.Step 2: The district officer reviews and approves the proposal.Step 3: Post approval, the beneficiary procures input materials (fish feed, medicines, equipment) from the open market.Step 4: Submit original purchase bills to the field staff.Step 5: Bills are verified by field personnel, and 50% of the cost is processed for payment.Step 6: The approved subsidy amount is credited directly to the farmer's bank account.
documents_required: Applicant PhotoAadhaar CardLand Ownership DocumentPermanent Residence CertificateCaste Certificate (If applicable, for SC/ST/OBC categories)Bank Account Details/Copy of Front Page of Bank PassbookMobile NumberDetails of Pond Related DocumentsPhoto of site/pondOriginal Bills/Invoices of procured items (Feed, Medicines, Hand nets, etc.)Copy Of Khasra / Khatoni
frequently_asked_questions: Who is eligible for this scheme?Fish farmers who are already engaged in fish farming activities in Uttarakhand are eligible.How much subsidy is provided?50% of the market cost of fish feed, medicines, and input materials.Is there a limit on the quantity of fish feed subsidized?Yes, based on pond size: up to 10 quintals.Can women fish farmers apply?Yes, women across all castes are eligible.Where do I submit the application?The office of the Assistant Director of Fisheries/District Fisheries In-charge at the district level.Can the input materials be purchased from any shop?Yes, but bills must be authentic and verifiable.Whom to contact for assistance?The office of the Assistant Director of Fisheries/District Fisheries In-charge at the district level.﻿﻿Is this scheme applicable to all castes and categories?Yes, it is applicable to all caste categories including General, SC, ST, OBC, and women fish farmers.Is there any physical verification of the fish farm?Yes, a Fishery Inspector or Field Officer conducts a field visit before approval.

title: PMMSY: Construction of Fish Kiosks Including Kiosks of Aquarium/Ornamental Fish-Haryana
details: The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana: Construction of Fish Kiosks including Kiosks of Aquarium/Ornamental fish" by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide central assistance for the construction of fish kiosks, including those for aquarium/ornamental fish.﻿
benefits: The project cost is ₹10,00,000/- per unit. Subsidy of 40% of the project cost for General Category beneficiaries. Subsidy of 60% of the project cost for SC/Women beneficiaries.﻿
eligibility: The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).The applicant should submit an undertaking in the Detailed Project Report (DPR)/Self Contained Proposal (SCP) to the effect that all operational, maintenance, and post-construction management costs of the infrastructure facilities shall be borne by them.The applicant should ensure the fish kiosk will be kept in operational condition for 10 years.The applicant should display a board permanently at the infrastructure facilities to the effect that the fish kiosk is constructed with Central Assistance under the Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY).The applicant can only avail of central assistance for one unit.The projects having land on long-term registered lease shall also be considered for Central financial assistance under the scheme. However, the lease period/ agreement shall not be less than a minimum period of 10 (ten) years.
application_process: OnlineRegistration Process on Antyodaya-SARAL Portal:Step 1: Visit the Official Portal: Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.﻿Step 2: For registration, click on “New User/Register Here” and fill in all the mandatory details, i.e. Name, Email ID, Mobile Number & password. Click on ‘Submit’.Step 3: Verify the OTP received in the provided Email and Mobile Number. Alternatively, click on the Verification Link to activate the profile.﻿Login to Apply for the Scheme:Step 1: Visit the Official Portal: Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.﻿Step 2: The “Sign in here” option is available on the right side of the screen. Fill in the required credentials and click on the ‘Login’ button.Step 3: In the opened window, click on “Scheme/Services list”, and a list of schemes will appear on the screen.Step 4: Now, select the scheme and click on “Apply for Service/Scheme”.Step 5: Fill in all the details in the online application form and click on "Submit".﻿Track Your Service Online:Track Application/Appeal: Click here.Track Ticket: Click here.﻿Track Your Service Through SMS:Registered Mobile Number: Type SARAL and send to 9954699899 to track your application.Other Mobile Number: Type SARAL<space><Application ID/Ticket No.> and send to 9954699899 to track your application/ticket.﻿Contact Us:Helpline: 0172-3968400Email: saral.haryana@gov.in﻿Note: Govt. Charges: No Fee Service Charges:   ₹10/-Atal Seva Kendra Service Charges:  ₹10/-﻿
documents_required: Agreement 1 - Agreement Deed between fish kiosk owner and Fisheries Department.Date of Birth Certificate (Voting Card/Birth Certificate/Aadhar Card/Matriculation Certificate).Caste Certificate (from first class Magistrate/Tehsildar).Training Certificate of Beneficiary.Land Record (from Tehsil - Own Land-Jamabandi, Nakal Akshizra Farad, or Registered Lease Deed).Bills/Receipts/Vouchers.Photographs of the Fish Kiosk with Beneficiary.Details of Bank Account and PAN Card.Detailed Project Report (DPR)/Self Contained Proposal (SCP) as per Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) guidelines.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the main objective of this scheme?The scheme aims to provide central assistance for the construction of fish kiosks, including kiosks for aquarium/ornamental fish.What percentage of subsidy is provided for beneficiaries belonging to the General Category?General Category beneficiaries are eligible for a subsidy of 40% of the project cost. What percentage of subsidy is provided for beneficiaries belonging to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category or women?SC and women beneficiaries are eligible for a subsidy of 60% of the project cost. Is there a limit to the number of units an individual beneficiary can receive assistance for?Yes, central assistance is restricted to one unit for an individual beneficiary.What undertaking must beneficiaries submit regarding operational and maintenance costs?Beneficiaries must submit an undertaking in the DPR/SCP stating that all operational, maintenance, and post-construction management costs of the infrastructure facilities shall be borne by them.What is the primary document required to establish beneficiary eligibility?The beneficiary must have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) for eligibility.For how long must the fish kiosk be kept in operational condition by the beneficiary?The fish kiosk must be kept in operational condition for a minimum period of 10 years. What kind of display board is required at the constructed fish kiosk?Beneficiaries must permanently display a board at the infrastructure facilities stating that the fish kiosk is constructed with Central Assistance under the Pradhan Mantya Matasya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY). Are projects on leased land eligible for central financial assistance under this scheme?Yes, projects having land on long-term registered lease shall also be considered for Central financial assistance.What is the first document required to be submitted related to the ownership of the fish kiosk?An Agreement 1, which is an agreement deed between the fish kiosk owner and the Fisheries Department, is required.What are the accepted documents for proof of date of birth?Accepted documents for proof of date of birth include Voting Card, Birth Certificate, Aadhar Card, or Matriculation Certificate.From whom should the Caste Certificate be obtained?The Caste Certificate must be obtained from a first-class Magistrate (Tehsildar). What financial documents are required to be submitted?Bills/Receipts/Vouchers, along with details of the Bank Account and Pan Card, are required.

title: PMMSY: Large Fish Feed Mill of Production Capacity of 20 Ton /Day Scheme - Haryana
details: The "Large Fish Feed Mill with Production Capacity of 20 Ton/Per Day" scheme was launched by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY), it aims to strengthen post-harvest infrastructure and enhance fish feed production to support sustainable aquaculture. Under this scheme, a grant is provided to beneficiaries for setting up a large fish feed mill, with 40% subsidy for general category and 60% for Scheduled Caste/Women beneficiaries. ﻿
benefits: Monetary Assistance:Grant of ₹20,00,000/- per unit for establishing a fish feed mill with 20-ton/day capacity.Subsidy Provisions:40% subsidy on unit cost for General Category beneficiaries.60% subsidy on unit cost for Scheduled Caste and women beneficiaries.﻿﻿
eligibility: The applicant must possess a Family Identity Card (Parivar Pehchan Patra).The applicant must ensure the feed mill remains functional and that feed is provided to fishers and fish farmers at affordable prices.The projects having land on long-term registered lease shall also be considered under the scheme. The registered land lease period/agreement shall not be less than a minimum period of 10 (ten) years.
application_process: OnlineRegistration Process on Antyodaya-SARAL Portal:Step 1: Visit the Official Portal: Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.﻿Step 2: For registration, click on “New User/Register Here” and fill in all the mandatory details i.e. Name, Email ID, Mobile Number & password. Click on ‘Submit’.Step 3: Verify the OTP received in the provided Email and Mobile Number. Alternatively, click on the Verification Link to activate the profile.﻿Login to Apply for the Scheme:Step 1: Visit the Official Portal: Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.﻿Step 2: The “Sign in here” option is available on the right side of the screen. Fill in the required credentials and click on the ‘Login’ button.Step 3: In the opened window, click on “Scheme/Services list”, and a list of schemes will appear on the screen.Step 4: Now, select the scheme and click on “Apply for Service/Scheme”.Step 5: Fill in all the details in the online application form and click on "Submit".﻿Track Your Service Online:Track Application/Appeal: Click here.Track Ticket: Click here.﻿Track Your Service Through SMS:Registered Mobile Number: Type SARAL and send to 9954699899 to track your application.Other Mobile Number: Type SARAL<space><Application ID/Ticket No.> and send to 9954699899 to track your application/ticket.﻿Contact Us:Helpline: 0172-3968400Email: saral.haryana@gov.in﻿Note: Govt. Charges: No FeeService Charges:   ₹10/-Atal Seva Kendra Service Charges:  ₹10/-﻿
documents_required: Date of Birth Certificate (Voting Card/Birth Certificate/Aadhar Card/Matriculation Certificate).Caste Certificate (Caste Certificate from first-class Magistrate (Tehsildar/SDM)).Agreement 1 (Agreement deed between the beneficiary and the Fisheries Department).Training Certificate of the Beneficiary (related to the operation/maintenance of fish feed mill).Land Record (issued from Tehsil (Land-Jamabandi, Nakal Akshizra/Fard/Registered Patta Nama) and the land title should be clear. Additionally, the latest .Jamabandi/Fard/ Akshizra should be attachedGST Bills.Photographs of Fish Feed Mill with the Beneficiary.Details of Bank Account and Pan Card.Detailed Project Report (DPR) or Self Contained Proposal (SCP) (as per the guidelines issued under the Centrally Sponsored.Scheme PMMMSY).All bills of amount more than ₹50,000/- should be as per E-way/Income Tax/GST rules.Certificate from the C.A. with the bills submitted for the subsidy case, certifying that the payments for the goods purchased by the beneficiary comply with Income Tax/GST regulations.CLU/NOC/Pollution/Fire Certificate (from the concerned department).NOC (from the Gram Sabha/Municipal Corporation/Authority of the area where the unit is located).Site Plan/Area Site Plan must be attached with the subsidy case.Note: All the documents should be in readable form.﻿
frequently_asked_questions: Who is eligible to apply for the fish feed mill subsidy?Any individual with a Family Identity Card and relevant fisheries training.What is the grant amount?The grant amount is ₹20,00,000 per unit.What is the production capacity supported under this scheme?The 20 tons per day production capacity is supported.How many units can one applicant apply for?Only one unit is allowed per applicant.Is leased land eligible?Yes, with a registered lease of at least 10 years.What documents are mandatory?DPR, land records, training certificate, CA certificate, PAN, and bank details.Is GST mandatory for bills submitted?Yes, for bills exceeding ₹50,000.What if the unit is already constructed?The subsidy is only applicable if the DPR and proposal are pre-approved.What is the timeline for application processing?Within 50 working days.Where can I apply for this scheme?The applicant can apply at the local District Fisheries Office or the Antyodaya SARAL portal.

title: PMMSY: Construction of New Grow Out Ponds - Haryana
details: The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana: Construction of New Grow out Ponds" by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to expand fisheries in various urban and semi-urban areas through the construction of new grow-out ponds. Through this scheme, subsidies are provided for the construction of new grow-out ponds to beneficiaries who are engaged in fisheries.﻿
benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance for the Construction of the New Grow-out Ponds. The project cost is ₹7,00,000/- per Hectare.The subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost for beneficiaries falling under the General Category.The subsidy will be limited to 60% of the project cost for beneficiaries who are Scheduled Caste (SC) or Women.﻿﻿
eligibility: The applicant must have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).The construction of new grow-out ponds subsidy will be provided by the State Government for the expansion of fisheries in various urban/semi-urban areas only under the construction of new grow-out ponds under the Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) scheme.Central financial assistance for the construction of new grow-out ponds will be provided only for the ponds prepared for fisheries.The applicant should have own land with clear title or having land on a long-term registered lease, not less than a minimum of 7 years.
application_process: OnlineRegistration Process on Antyodaya-SARAL Portal:Step 1: Visit the Official Portal: Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.﻿Step 2: For registration, click on “New User/Register Here” and fill in all the mandatory details, i.e. Name, Email ID, Mobile Number & password. Click on ‘Submit’.Step 3: Verify the OTP received in the provided Email and Mobile Number. Alternatively, click on the Verification Link to activate the profile.﻿Login to Apply for the Scheme:Step 1: Visit the Official Portal: Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.﻿Step 2: The “Sign in here” option is available on the right side of the screen. Fill in the required credentials and click on the ‘Login’ button.Step 3: In the opened window, click on “Scheme/Services list”, and a list of schemes will appear on the screen.Step 4: Now, select the scheme and click on “Apply for Service/Scheme”.Step 5: Fill in all the details in the online application form and click on "Submit".﻿Track Your Service Online:Track Application/Appeal: Click here.Track Ticket: Click here.﻿Track Your Service Through SMS:Registered Mobile Number: Type SARAL and send to 9954699899 to track your application.Other Mobile Number: Type SARAL<space><Application ID/Ticket No.> and send to 9954699899 to track your application/ticket.﻿Contact Us:Helpline: 0172-3968400Email: saral.haryana@gov.in﻿Note: Govt. Charges: No Fee Service Charges:   ₹10/-Atal Seva Kendra Service Charges:  ₹10/-﻿
documents_required: Agreement Deed between Beneficiary and Fisheries Department.Date of Birth Certificate (Voting Card/ Birth Certificate/ Aadhar Card/ Matriculation Certificate).Caste Certificate (from first-class Magistrate, Tehsildar).Training Certificate of Beneficiary.Land Record from Tehsil (Own Land-Jamabandi, Nakal Akshizra Farad) or Registered Lease Deed of Minimum 7 Years.Bills/Receipts/Vouchers.Photographs of Ponds/Nurseries/Aerators, etc. with Beneficiary.Details of Bank Account and PAN Card.Detailed Project Report (DPR)/Self-Contained Proposal (SCP) as per PMMSY guidelines.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the scheme objective?This scheme provides a subsidy for the construction of new grow-out ponds to expand fisheries in urban and semi-urban areas.Will central financial assistance be provided for all ponds?No, central financial assistance for the construction of new grow-out ponds will only be provided for ponds specifically prepared for fisheries.What percentage of subsidy can a general category beneficiary receive?Beneficiaries in the General Category can receive a subsidy limited to 40% of the project cost.What percentage of subsidy can a Scheduled Caste (SC) or woman beneficiary receive?SC and women beneficiaries can receive a higher subsidy, limited to 60% of the project cost.Do I need to own the land to be eligible for this scheme, or can I lease it?You must have your own land with a clear title or have land on a long-term registered lease.What is the minimum duration required for a registered land lease to be eligible?The registered land lease must not be less than 7 years.What documents are required to prove my date of birth for the application?You can provide your Voting Card, Birth Certificate, Aadhaar Card, or Matriculation Certificate.Is a training certificate necessary for the beneficiary to apply for this scheme?Yes, a Training Certificate of the beneficiary is required.Which authority issues the caste certificate that is required for the application?A Caste Certificate from a First Class Magistrate (Tehsildar) is required.What specific land records are needed if I own the land?If you own the land, you need to provide Jamabandi and Nakal Akshizra Farad from the Tehsil.What if I have leased land instead of owning it, what document is needed then?If you have leased land, a registered lease deed of a minimum of 7 years is required.Are there any restrictions on the location where new grow-out ponds can be constructed under the scheme?Yes, construction of new grow-out ponds is for the expansion of fisheries in various urban and semi-urban areas only.

title: PMMSY: Construction of New ponds for Saline /Alkaline areas-Haryana
details: The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana: Construction of New Ponds for Saline/Alkaline Areas" by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Haryana, aims to expand fisheries in various urban and semi-urban areas. Through this scheme, subsidies for the construction of new ponds and central financial assistance for the initial fish crop on newly constructed ponds are provided to beneficiaries. The scheme considers ponds with a long duration and a registered lease period of at least 7 years for grants.
benefits: The project cost is ₹8,00,000/- per hectare. The subsidy is limited to 40% of the project cost for the General Category and 60% of the project cost for Scheduled Caste (SC) and women beneficiaries.﻿
eligibility: The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).The construction of new ponds subsidy will be provided by the state government for the expansion of fisheries in various urban/semi-urban areas only under the construction of new ponds under the Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) scheme.Only central financial assistance will be provided to the beneficiaries for the initial fish crop only on the fertiliser of newly constructed ponds.Central financial assistance on the construction of new ponds will be provided only on ponds prepared for fisheries.Under this scheme, ponds whose pond duration will be for a long time, and the registered lease period will be at least 7 years, will be considered for a grant on those ponds.

Photographs of the Pond with the Beneficiary.Details of Bank Account and PAN Card.Detailed Project Report (DPR)/Self Contained Proposal (SCP) (as per Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana guidelines).
frequently_asked_questions: What is the main objective of this scheme?The scheme aims to provide a subsidy for the construction of new ponds for the expansion of fisheries in various urban/semi-urban areas.What kind of financial assistance is provided for the initial fish crop?Only central financial assistance will be provided to the beneficiaries for the initial fish crop on the fertiliser of newly constructed ponds.What is the minimum registered lease period required for a pond to be considered for a grant?The registered lease period must be at least 7 years.What is the subsidy rate for beneficiaries belonging to the General Category?For the General Category, the subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost.What is the subsidy rate for women beneficiaries?For women beneficiaries, the subsidy will be limited to 60% of the project cost.What is the first document required from the beneficiary for this scheme?The first document required is an Agreement Deed between the beneficiary and the Fisheries Department.What options are accepted as proof of date of birth?Voting Card, Birth Certificate, Aadhar Card, or Matriculation Certificate are accepted.Who needs to issue the Caste Certificate for it to be valid?The Caste Certificate must be from a first-class Magistrate (Tehsildar).Is a training certificate mandatory for the beneficiary?Yes, a Training Certificate of the beneficiary is required.Are bills, receipts, or vouchers necessary documents?Yes, Bills/Receipts/Vouchers are required.Are photographs of the pond required for the application?Yes, photographs of the pond with the beneficiary are required.What kind of project proposal does the beneficiary need to submit?The beneficiary will submit a Detailed Project Report (DPR) or Self-Contained Proposal (SCP) as per Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana guidelines.

title: Scheme for the Welfare of Schedule Caste Families in Fisheries Sector: Subsidy on 2nd Year to 5th Year Lease Money
details: The “Subsidy on 2nd Year to 5th Year Lease Money” is a scheme component under the Scheme for the Welfare of Scheduled Caste Families in the Fisheries Sector, launched by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. The objective of the scheme is to provide full-time employment to individuals from Scheduled Caste families in the fisheries sector and uplift their economic status by promoting fish farming through financial assistance for leasing Panchayati ponds or watershed areas. Under this scheme, a subsidy is provided to Scheduled Caste beneficiaries to partially cover the lease amount for Panchayati ponds or watershed areas from the second year to the fifth year, thereby reducing long-term operational costs and facilitating the continuation of pond lease arrangements.﻿
benefits: Financial Assistance:40% of the actual lease amount OR ₹40,000/- per hectare, whichever is less.The subsidy is applicable for a maximum of 4 hectares per beneficiary.Note:  Subsidy will be provided on lease money from 2nd to 5th year of lease. ﻿
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.The applicant should have a valid Family ID Card (Parivar Pehchan Patra).The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Caste category.The applicant's age should be 18 years or above.Subsidy will be provided on lease money from 2nd to 5th year of lease.The maximum area eligible for subsidy is 4 hectares per applicant.The subsidy is applicable only on Panchayati ponds and government water sheds.﻿
exclusions: The applicant must not be a Government/ Semi-Government employee. ﻿

Click on ‘Submit’.Step 3: Verify the OTP received in the provided Email and Mobile Number. Fill in the required credentials and click on the ‘Login’ button.Step 3: In the opened window, click on “Scheme/Services list” and a list of schemes will appear on the screen.Step 4: Now, select the scheme and click on “Apply for Service/Scheme”.Step 5: Fill in all the details in the online application form and click on "Submit".Track Your Service Online:Track Application/Appeal: Click here.Track Ticket: Click here.Track Your Service Through SMS:Registered Mobile Number: Type SARAL and send to 9954699899 to track your application.Other Mobile Number: Type SARAL<space><Application ID/Ticket No.> and send to 9954699899 to track your application/ticket.Contact Us: Helpline: 0172-3968400Email: saral.haryana@gov.inFees For Service:Government Charges: ₹0 (No Fee)Service Charges: ₹10Atal Seva Kendra Charges: ₹10﻿
documents_required: Agreement 1 - Agreement deed between fish farmer and Fisheries DepartmentAgreement 2 - Agreement deed between fish farmer and panchayat for fish cultureDate of Birth Certificate - Birth Certificate/Matriculation Certificate/PAN Card/Voter Card/Driving LicenseIdentity Proof – Ration Card/Aadhar Card/PAN Card/Voter CardCaste Certificate - Caste Certificate issued by 1st Class MagistrateTraining Certificate – Fisheries Training from any Govt. InstituteLease deed - (Panchayat Resolution and receipt no.4 of Panchayat). Receipt of Fish Seed (purchased from government/national fish seed farms)Photographs of the Pond Site﻿
frequently_asked_questions: Who can apply for this scheme?Scheduled Caste fish farmers who have completed the first year of pond lease in Haryana.﻿What is the financial assistance amount?₹40,000/- per hectare or 40% of actual lease cost, whichever is less, up to 4 hectares.﻿Is this subsidy available in the first year?No, this scheme covers years 2 to 5 only.﻿Can private ponds be leased under this scheme?No, only Panchayati ponds/watersheds are eligible.﻿Is there any age restriction?Yes, the applicant must be 18 years or older.﻿What is the maximum area eligible for the grant?Up to 4 hectares per beneficiary.﻿Where can I apply?At the District Fisheries Office or Atal Seva Kendra (ASK).﻿﻿﻿Are photographs necessary?Yes, site-related photographs must be submitted.﻿
