eligibility: The beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Gujarat.The beneficiary should belong to the Scheduled Tribe category.The individual farmer or FPO/FPC/FIG/SHG/Co-operative society is eligible to avail of benefits under the scheme.The assistance will be available once in five years.Equipment certified by ISO/BIS/ISI/Government-Recognized organizations should be purchased through an authorized dealer of that company or imported equipment.

title: Talab Matsyiki Vishesh Sahayata Yojana (Anusuchit Jaati/Janajati/Ati Pichhada)
details: The "Talab Matsyiki Vishesh Sahayata Yojana (Anusuchit Jaati/Janajati/Ati Pichhada)" was launched by the Animal and Fisheries Resources Department, Government of Bihar. This scheme aims to support fish farmers from Scheduled Castes, Tribes, and Extremely Backward Classes by providing financial and technical assistance for pond construction, installation of necessary equipment, and other related activities. The scheme has a total budget of ₹2994.60 lakh and seeks to enhance livelihood opportunities, ensure food and protein security, and promote employment among these communities.
benefits: AssistanceOffers a 70% subsidy on the total cost, reducing the financial burden on beneficiaries.﻿Subsidy Payment:Subsidy payments are made in two installments: 60% after pond construction and 40% after installation of related units and purchase of inputs.
eligibility: The applicant should belong to Scheduled Castes, Tribes, or Most Backward Classes.The applicant should have private or leased land available for pond construction.﻿
application_process: OnlineRegistration Process:Step-01: The applicant visits the official website and clicks the "Applications are being invited for all the schemes of the financial year (2024-25), click here to apply. Apply online for Training and Tour Darshan Scheme."Step-02: Select the "Registration for Fisheries Schemes"Step-03: Select the category: Individual and complete all basic details of the applicant for registration, including category, caste, applicant name, date of birth, address, bank details, etc.Step-04: Enter a valid 10-digit mobile number and click to send OTP.Step-05: An OTP will be sent to the provided mobile number.Step-06: Enter the OTP; after verification of the OTP, you will receive a Registration Number and Password.Step-07: Click on the "Login" and enter the Registration Number and Password.﻿Application Form Filling Process:Step-01: The applicant visits the official website and clicks the "Applications are being invited for all the schemes of the financial year (2024-25), click here to apply. Apply online for Training and Tour Darshan Scheme."Step-02: Click "If your already register, login here". Step-03: Select "Application for fishery scheme" option and choose the scheme name "Talab Matsyiki Vishesh Sahayata Yojana (Anusuchit Jaati/Janajati/Ati Pichhada)", after the application form is open.Step-04: The application form will capture registration personal data details.Step-05: Fill in the bank and land details. Step-06: Click on the submit button as well print the application form and submit it to the District Fisheries Office along with attachments. ﻿Note: Download the Affidavit form and Consent form also attached with the application.
documents_required: Completed Application Form.Photograph of Proposed Land.Bank details (branch name, account number, IFSC code).Attested copies of Training Certificate.Aadhar Card, Ration Card, Voter ID.Land Map.Caste Certificate.Land Ownership Certificate/Revenue Receipt (for private land).Registered Lease Agreement/Non-judicial Stamp Agreement (for lease land).Notarized Affidavit Confirming the land is dispute-free.
frequently_asked_questions:
What is the total budget of the scheme? The total budget of the scheme is ₹2994.60 lakh.How much financial assistance is provided per acre?A maximum of ₹10,10,000/- per acre is provided for pond construction and related units.What is the minimum assistance provided per unit?A minimum of ₹6,20,000/- is provided per unit (0.5 acre).Who is eligible for the scheme?Indian nationals from Scheduled Castes, Tribes, or Most Backward Classes with private or lease land are eligible.How is the subsidy paid?The subsidy is paid in two installments: 60% after pond construction and 40% after installation of related units and purchase of inputs.How are beneficiaries selected?Beneficiaries are selected based on the scrutiny of applications by a committee headed by the Deputy Fisheries Director.

Is there a waiting list for the scheme?Yes, a waiting list is prepared if the number of eligible applications exceeds the target.


Can applicants apply for more than one acre of land?No, the scheme limits assistance to a maximum of one acre per person/family.What happens if there are errors in the application?Applicants will be given time to rectify errors. Applications without errors will be considered for selection.

What is the benefit of the package assistance?It provides a solid foundation for pond fisheries, increases fish product diversity, ensures sustainable income and employment, and promotes climate-friendly fisheries.

Can the subsidy be used for ponds less than 0.5 acre?No, the subsidy is not provided for ponds less than 0.5 acre.What facilities are included in the package assistance?Facilities include the construction of rearing ponds, installation of tube wells and pumps, mechanical aerators, improved inputs, and shed construction.

Is there any priority for applications submitted early?Yes, priority is given to applicants who submit complete and error-free applications first.

Can applicants use bank loans to cover additional costs?Yes, applicants can use bank loans to cover any costs exceeding the scheme's assistance limit.

title: National Livestock Mission: Genetic Improvement of Pig Breeds - Import of Exotic Pig Germplasm
details: The "Import of Exotic Pig Germplasm" is a component under the Genetic Improvement of Pig Breeds activity of the Sub-Mission on Breed Development of Livestock and Poultry, part of the National Livestock Mission (NLM). This initiative is introduced by the Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying, under the Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying, Government of India. Under this scheme, the Central Government will assist the States for need based import of pig germplasm to increase productivity of the non-descript animals and to produce good quality cross bred animals to increase per animal meat production. The superior exotic breeds will be maintained as pure breeds in the nucleus farms at the state government. However, the State needs to formulate and notify their breeding policy for pigs before sending the proposal for import of germplasm. The scheme is implemented by the State Implementing Agencies of the State Animal Husbandry Department.Objectives:Inclusion of superior male germplasm in existing native gene pool for genetic upgradation of indigenous pigs for production of crossbred animals with higher per animal productivity.
benefits: Pattern of Assistance:One time assistance will be provided to the state for import of pig exotic germplasm in the form of live animals on cost sharing basis 60:40 for all States except NER & Himalayan States where it will be 90:10.
eligibility: Eligible Beneficiaries:State Livestock AgenciesState Livestock BoardsAnimal Husbandry Department, State Government
application_process: OnlineStep 1: Visit the Official Website of "National Livestock Mission" and click "Apply Here".Step 2: The following methods of Logging In will be displayed:Login as EntrepreneurLogin as Government / Other AgenciesLogin as Research & InnovationLogin to the website using your preferred method.Step 3: On the next page, verify your Mobile Number via OTP. You will be taken to the Online Application Form. Step 4: In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size.Step 5: Agree to the "Declaration & Authorization" by ticking the checkbox. Provide the Date & Place, and finally click "Submit".Post-Application ProcessesStep 1: Screening of application by State Implementing Agency (SIA)SIA will scrutinize the submitted application and will recommend the application of the entrepreneurs/ eligible entities to avail balance financing for the project through scheduled banks or financial institutions like National Cooperative Development Corporation (NCDC) etc.Step 2: Loan sanction by LenderAfter the recommendation of the project by SIA, the same will be considered by the bank or financial institutions for financing. Lender will pick the application along with all the documents from the portal and will approve the loan after examining the project/ documents submitted by applicant and completing their internal diligent process. After sanctioning the loan, Lender will upload sanction letter on the portal.Step 3: Recommendation from State Level Executive Committee (SLEC)Once the bank or financial institution sanction the project, SIA shall place the same in SLEC for recommending the application to the Central Government (Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying).Step 4: Approval of subsidy by DAHDDAHD will approve the subsidy and will mark the approval of the same on portal.Step 5: Disbursement and release of subsidyAfter compliance of terms and conditions mentioned in the sanction letter, lender will disburse the loan amount to the beneficiary. fund the subsidy amount for the approved projects through Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) to the lending Bank or financial institutions as the case may be to release the subsidy to Beneficiaries.Track Application StatusYou can check your application status from the "TRACK STATUS" tab available in the upper right corner of the portalHelp and SupportIf you encounter any issues or have questions, visit the "Contact Us" page.
documents_required: 1.	Details of agency2.	Project Proposal details3.	Budget Estimates4.	Approval from Competent Authority5.	Bank Account Details6.	Any other documents as required
frequently_asked_questions: What is the financial assistance provided under the scheme?One-time assistance is provided to states for importing exotic pig germplasm on a cost-sharing basis of 60:40, except for North Eastern and Himalayan States, where it is 90:10.How will the imported pig germplasm be used?The superior exotic breeds will be maintained as pure breeds in nucleus farms at the state government level for further breeding programs.Is there any requirement for states before applying for germplasm import?Yes, states must formulate and notify their breeding policy for pigs before submitting the proposal.How can a state government submit a proposal for assistance?The state government must submit a formal proposal, including their breeding policy and an official request, to the concerned authorities.Can private pig farms apply for assistance under this scheme?No, only state government agencies, livestock boards, and animal husbandry departments are eligible for assistance.What is the role of pig semen collection and processing labs?These labs help in artificial breeding programs by collecting, processing, and storing pig semen for genetic improvement.Will the government provide funds for setting up semen collection labs?Yes, assistance is provided for establishing pig semen collection and processing labs under this scheme.Is there any financial support for pig farmers under this scheme?No, the scheme provides support only to state government agencies for genetic improvement programs.How does this scheme support states with weak pig farming infrastructure?States receive financial assistance for germplasm import and laboratory setup, helping them modernize pig breeding programs.Can states request assistance multiple times under this scheme?No, assistance for germplasm import is provided as a one-time financial support.What is the ratio of financial assistance for North Eastern and Himalayan States?For these states, financial assistance is provided at a 90:10 cost-sharing ratio.What types of exotic pig breeds are imported under this scheme?The scheme focuses on importing superior exotic pig breeds to improve productivity, but specific breeds are determined based on state requirements.Will the scheme provide technical support for breeding programs?The scheme primarily provides financial assistance, while technical support may be managed by the state’s animal husbandry department.What is the long-term goal of this scheme?The scheme aims to increase per-animal productivity, improve pig breed quality, and boost meat production across states.

Documents Required: https://www.nlm.udyamimitra.in/Default/ViewFile/?id=NLM_List_of_Documents.docx&path=MiscFiles

title: Construction of Dudhghar/ Godown (Scheduled Tribe Area)
details: The scheme "Construction of Dudhghar/ Godown (Scheduled Tribe Area)" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial support to Village Milk Producer Co-operative Societies in Scheduled Tribe areas that lack their own milk storage or cattle feed storage infrastructure. It also promotes installation of bulk milk coolers and similar equipment.
benefits: ﻿Name of the ComponentStandard of assistanceRemarksMinimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming BenefitsDudhghar/ GodownUnit price (₹10,00,000/-)or actual expenditure occurs for construction, out of that 50% of whichever is less.Maximum ₹5,00,000/-Once in lifetime﻿
eligibility: The Society must not already own a Dudhghar or Godown.The Society must have its own land available for the construction of the Dudhghar or Godown.The Society must not have availed of the benefit earlier under this or any other scheme for a similar purpose.
application_process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Animal Husbandry Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.Note: Required Documents can also be submitted in hard copies to the office mentioned in the application form within 7 days.
documents_required: Copy of Bank Passbook or cancelled cheque.Proof of own land for construction of Dudhghar/Godown.Certificate of not availing benefit earlier in same scheme/other scheme with similar purpose by Managing Director of Dairy Union.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the objective of the "Construction of Dudhghar/ Godown (Scheduled Tribe Area)" scheme?The objective of the scheme is to support Village Milk Producer Co-operative Societies  of Scheduled Tribe area in constructing Dudhghars and Godowns to ensure hygienic milk production and proper storage of cattle feed.﻿﻿Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?Only Village Milk Producer Co-operative Societies located in Scheduled Tribe areas of Gujarat are eligible to apply for the scheme.﻿﻿What financial assistance is provided under the scheme?The scheme provides financial assistance up to ₹5,00,000/- or 50% of the unit cost, whichever is less, for the construction of Dudhghar or Godown.﻿﻿Is the benefit under the scheme provided more than once?No, the benefit under this scheme is provided only once in a lifetime to each eligible society.﻿﻿Can an individual dairy farmer apply for this scheme?No, individual dairy farmers are not eligible. Only registered Village Milk Producer Co-operative Societies can apply.﻿﻿Is it mandatory for the society to own land for construction?Yes, it is mandatory for the society to have its own land for the construction of the Dudhghar or Godown.﻿﻿How can a society apply for the scheme?The society can apply online through the iKhedut portal.﻿﻿Is document submission required after online application?Yes, the society must upload the required documents online or submit them in hard copy to the concerned office within 7 days of the online application.﻿﻿What documents are required for application?The required documents include a copy of the bank passbook or cancelled cheque, proof of land ownership, and a certificate from the Managing Director of the Dairy Union confirming that the benefit has not been availed earlier.﻿﻿What happens if the society has already received benefits under a similar scheme?If the society has already availed benefits under this or a similar scheme, it will not be eligible for assistance again.﻿﻿Is there a time limit for submitting documents after application?Yes, all required documents must be submitted within 7 days of completing the online application.﻿﻿Can the society install bulk milk coolers using this assistance?Yes, the financial assistance can be used for installing bulk milk coolers and similar equipment to support milk storage and hygiene.﻿﻿

title: Fair Recreational Activity and Non-Competitive Involvement in Sports Urban Connect Scheme (F.R.A.N.C.I.S Urban Connect Scheme)
details: Launched in 2013, the scheme "Fair Recreational Activity and Non-Competitive Involvement in Sports Urban Connect Scheme (F.R.A.N.C.I.S Urban Connect Scheme)" by the Department of Urban Development, Government of Goa aims to provide safe play areas for healthy recreation and sports to urban communities. Assistance is provided to develop safe play areas in urban spaces, benefiting local municipal bodies, schools, colleges, registered sports clubs, and registered housing societies, etc. The scheme is implemented by the Goa State Urban Development Agency (GSUDA), which acts as the nodal agency. The scheme operates within the provisions of the Integrated Development of Major Towns Scheme (IDMT).
benefits: Development of safe play areas for healthy recreation and sports.Provision of facilities such as walking tracks, volleyball courts, basketball courts, athletics tracks, football fields, hockey fields, artificial rock climbing walls, and tennis courts.Additional amenities like changing rooms, toilet blocks, storage spaces, illumination, and mild steel fencing.Funding assistance up to ₹3,00,00,000/- for A-Class Municipal Councils/Corporations, up to ₹2,50,00,000/- for B-Class Municipal Councils, and up to ₹1,00,00,000/- for C-Class Municipal Councils.Encouragement of corporate sponsorships and public-private partnership (PPP) models for future sustainability.Free access to non-formal facilities and affordable pay-and-play schemes.Availability of coaching facilities and linkages with local sports associations.
eligibility: The following entities owning land not less than 2,000 square meters within the Municipal jurisdiction shall be eligible for the benefit under this scheme:(a) Local Municipal body;(b) Schools, colleges, or such other institutions;(c) Registered Sports Clubs;(d) Registered Housing Societies;(e) Other Registered bodies espousing the cause of Physical fitness and Sport:Provided that an applicant whose land falls in any of the peripheral Panchayat jurisdiction may be considered eligible.
application_process: OfflineStep 1: Submission of ApplicationFill out the Application Form (Annexure 1) with all required details, including the proposed facilities, justification, and business plan. Submit the completed application form to the Nodal Agency (Goa State Urban Development Agency) along with any supporting documents.Step 3: Scrutiny and ApprovalThe Director of the Department of Urban Development will appoint a scrutiny committee to review the application.The scrutiny committee will recommend the case to the Nodal Officer, who, in consultation with the Chairman of the Nodal Agency, will approve the application for benefits under the scheme.Step 4: Signing the Memorandum of Understanding (M.O.U.)Once approved, the beneficiary must sign an M.O.U. with the Nodal Agency, outlining the terms and conditions for the development and maintenance of the facilities.Step 5: Implementation and MonitoringThe Nodal Agency will draw up a feasibility report, design, build, and transfer the facilities to the beneficiary.*The beneficiary will be responsible for maintaining and operating the facilities, with periodic community impact studies conducted by the Nodal Agency.
documents_required: Any documents as required by the Nodal Agency to verify the information provided in the application form (Annexure 1): Registration Details, Location With Survey Numbers, Area of Land, Land Ownership Status, Business Plan, Management Structure, Operational Details.*Upon approval of the application, the beneficiary must sign a Memorandum of Understanding (M.O.U.) (Annexure 2) with the Nodal Agency, outlining the terms and conditions for the development and maintenance of the facilities.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the minimum land area requirement for an entity to be eligible for assistance under this urban recreation scheme?An entity must own land not less than 2000 square meters within Municipal jurisdiction to be eligible for benefits under the scheme.How can a school or college that owns land in a peripheral Panchayat jurisdiction qualify for the urban recreation assistance?An applicant whose land falls in any of the peripheral Panchayat jurisdiction may be considered eligible, even if it's outside municipal limits.What sporting facilities can be developed on the available land under this urban development initiative?Permissible activities include walking track, volleyball court, basketball court, athletics track of 200 meters, football field (30x40m), hockey field (40x20m), artificial rock climbing wall, and tennis court. Dimensions may vary based on land availability.What additional support facilities are permitted to be constructed alongside the sports infrastructure?Additional facilities permitted include changing rooms for men and women, toilet blocks, storage space for equipment, illumination, and mild steel fencing, along with other requirements deemed essential by the Nodal Officer.What preference is given to football facilities in terms of surface quality?Football gets preference for FIFA approved synthetic turfs to maintain focus on the official sports of Goa.What special considerations are given for athletics and hockey surfaces?If the Nodal Agency determines scope exists, they may consider laying IAAF and FIH approved synthetic surfaces for Athletics and Hockey.What are the different funding limits available based on municipal council classification?A Class Municipal Councils/Corporation can receive up to Rs. 3.0 crores, B Class up to Rs. 2.5 crores, and C Class up to Rs. 1 crore.What is the duration of the agreement that beneficiaries must maintain the facilities after creation?The MoU between parties shall be effective for five years from execution, during which the beneficiary cannot alter/dismantle/dispose of any assets created.What are the operational requirements regarding public access to the facilities once developed?Beneficiaries must provide generally free access to non-formal facilities and implement affordable pay-and-play schemes for other facilities.How should an applicant demonstrate financial sustainability in their proposal?Applicants must submit a self-contained business plan establishing project sustainability, including meeting operations and maintenance costs.What coaching-related commitments must be made by the applicant organization?The organization must ensure availability of coaching facilities and demonstrate their ability to deploy coaches and support staff.What partnerships are applicants required to establish for facility management?Applicants must establish linkages with respective local Sports Associations and may pursue business partnerships to enhance financial viability.What information must be provided about existing sports infrastructure in the application?Applicants must provide details of discipline-wise infrastructure owned, managed, and operated by them, along with details of existing sports facilities.How should an applicant justify the community impact of their proposed facility?They must explain the impact of proposed infrastructure on community development and identification of new talent in their application.What management information must be included in the application?Applicants must provide details of their management structure for operations of both existing and proposed facilities.If you own land within municipal jurisdiction, can you operate the facility purely for commercial purposes?No, the sports facilities created/upgraded under the MoU may only be used for specified purposes on a non-commercial basis.Are educational institutions eligible to apply for this urban sports infrastructure assistance?Yes, schools, colleges, and other educational institutions owning the required land within Municipal jurisdiction are eligible beneficiaries.

title: Creation of Modern Facilities in Market Committee: Scheme to provide assistance foe setting up modern facilities in Market Committee
details: The scheme "Creation of Modern Facilities in Market Committee: Scheme to provide assistance foe setting up modern facilities in Market Committee" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to upgrade Agricultural Produce Market Committees (APMCs) with essential infrastructure, enabling farmers to increase production, enhance product quality, and secure better prices for their produce.
benefits: ﻿Name of the ComponentStandard of Assistance1) Sales cum exhibition centre; 2) Shed/platform for farmers; 3) Demonstration farm for drip irrigation; 4) Information kiosk in vegetable market100% of project cost to all types of market committees up to a limit of ₹50,00,000/-5) Soil testing laboratory; 6) Water system like borewell, tube well, water cooler, water cooler with RO plant, overhead tank, underground tank etc.; 7) Solar light system25% of the project cost to "A'' and "B" class market committees and 50% of the project cost to Class "C" and "D" Market Committees (Within a limit of ₹50,00,000/-)﻿
eligibility: All Market Committees of Gujarat State shall be eligible for this scheme.
application_process: OfflineStep 1: Market committees need to prepare development plans and cost estimates with an engineer on the panel approved by the Director-Agricultural Markets and Rural Finance.Step 2: Submit the proposal to the Deputy Director and District Registrar of Co-operative Societies of the respective district.Office Address and Contact Details of District Registrar: Click here.
documents_required: Development work maps and cost estimatesEngineer’s certification from the approved panelProposal submission letterAny other documents required by the authorities
frequently_asked_questions:
What is the objective of this scheme?The objective of this scheme is to enhance the infrastructure of agricultural markets in Gujarat to ensure better market access, fair pricing, and improved facilities for farmers. Who is eligible for this scheme?Only Market Committees in Gujarat are eligible to apply.


What kind of financial assistance is provided?The scheme offers 100% assistance up to ₹50,00,000/- for certain projects and 25%-50% assistance for others, depending on the classification of the Market Committee.


What projects are covered under this scheme?Projects like sales-cum-exhibition centers, farmer sheds, drip irrigation demonstration farms, information kiosks, soil testing laboratories, water systems, and solar light systems are covered.


Can individual farmers apply for this scheme?No, the scheme is only for Market Committees, not individual farmers.


Is there any preference given to certain Market Committees?Assistance percentages vary based on the classification of Market Committees (A, B, C, D).


Are private markets eligible under this scheme?No, only registered Market Committees of Gujarat can apply.


What is the process to apply for financial assistance?Market Committees need to submit a development plan and proposal through the Deputy Director and District Registrar, Co-operative Societies.

title: Goat Valley Scheme
details: The “Goat Valley” scheme was launched in 2022 by the Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Uttarakhand, as a cluster-based model for promoting entrepreneurship in the animal husbandry sector in the state. Its objectives include establishing Goat Valleys as clusters for organized goat rearing, promoting youth self-employment, transforming traditional goat rearing into profit-oriented enterprises and organising the sector to enhance year-round livelihood opportunities for farmers. This initiative brings together various schemes, such as the District Goat Rearing Program, State Goat Rearing Program, NCDC Loan, Deen Dayal Upadhyay Loan, and REAP to develop dedicated goat-saturated zones in each district.
benefits: 1. Goat Unit Establishment: Each beneficiary establishes a goat unit of 15+1 animals.2. Financial Support Structure:Loan: ₹30,000 loan from NCDC (National Cooperative Development Corporation).Subsidy: ₹63,000 subsidy.Beneficiary Contribution: Requires a ₹7,000 beneficiary contribution.Conditions/Aspects/Criteria associated with the benefits:The goat unit size is fixed at 15+1 animals.The specific financial contributions (loan, subsidy, beneficiary) are predetermined for each unit.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
application_process: OnlineRegistration Process:Step 1: Visit to e-Services Apuni Sarkar (https://eservices.uk.gov.in) and click “Sign Up” on the Citizen Login page.Step 2: Fill in the registration form with your name, email, mobile number, etc., and click Submit.Step 3: You will receive your User ID and password via SMS on your registered mobile number. Application Process:Step 1: Navigate to the Citizen Login page and enter your User ID (email or mobile) and password, complete the captcha, then click Sign In.Step 2: Once logged in, your dashboard appears. Click “Apply for New Application” or similar to begin. Step 3: Choose the Animal Husbandry department, from the list of services, select the scheme to apply for. Step 4: The portal will list mandatory documents required and upload mandatory documents, after uploading, click Submit to proceed. Step 5: Enter all required details in the form (personal, land, bank, etc.). Use Save to save progress, preview to review, or Delete Draft to reset.Step 6: Once all fields are accurately filled, click Submit. You will receive an Application ID receipt, which you can download. Track Application and ApprovalStep 1: The application goes to the concerned department for review.Step 2: You can track your application status on the portal using your Application ID.User Manual﻿Note: Beneficiaries are selected by a block-level committee after scrutinizing applications submitted through the Apuni Sarkar portal.
documents_required: Identity proofApplicant PhotographAddress proofIncome proofCaste certificate (if applicable)Any other documents if required
frequently_asked_questions: What is the main objective of the scheme?Its main objective is to establish Goat Valleys as clusters for sustainable livestock entrepreneurship, specifically organized goat rearing.How does the scheme aim to support youth in Uttarakhand?The initiative aims to promote youth self-employment within the livestock sector.What kind of transformation does the scheme seek for traditional goat farming?The scheme aims to transform traditional goat farming into profit-oriented enterprises.How does the scheme contribute to the livelihood of farmers?It aims to organize the sector to enhance year-round livelihood opportunities for farmers.Which various schemes are integrated into the scheme?This initiative brings together the District Goat Rearing Program, State Goat Rearing Program, NCDC Loan, Deen Dayal Upadhyay Loan, and REAP.What is the purpose of developing dedicated goat-saturated zones in each district?The integrated schemes aim to develop dedicated goat-saturated zones in each district.Who is eligible to be a beneficiary of the scheme?A beneficiary must be a resident of Uttarakhand.What is the size of the goat unit that each beneficiary establishes under the scheme?Each beneficiary establishes a goat unit consisting of 15+1 animals.What is the financing structure for establishing a goat unit under this scheme?The financing structure consists of a loan, a subsidy, and a beneficiary contribution.How much is the loan component for establishing a goat unit, and from which organization?The loan component is ₹30,000 from NCDC (National Cooperative Development Corporation).What is the amount of the subsidy provided for establishing a goat unit?The subsidy provided is ₹63,000.What is the required beneficiary contribution for establishing a goat unit?The required beneficiary contribution is ₹7,000.Through which online portal must applications for the scheme be submitted?Applications must be submitted through the Apuni Sarkar portal, which is https://eservices.uk.gov.in.﻿Who is responsible for selecting beneficiaries for the scheme?Beneficiaries are selected by a block-level committee.

title: Scheme for Supply of Improved Seeds for Fodder
details: The "Scheme for Supply of Improved Seeds for Fodder" launched by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat, aims to support institutions like Gaushalas and Panjarapols by providing them with improved fodder seeds such as maize, sorghum, oat, and lucerne. This encourages the cultivation of nutritious green fodder, especially on grazing lands (gauchar lands), thereby enhancing livestock health and productivity.
benefits: Maize: Up to 10 kits (5 kg each)Sorghum: Up to 50 kits (5 kg each)Oats: Up to 5 kits (5 kg each)Lucerne: Up to 20 kits (2 kg each)
eligibility: Panjrapol must be registered under the Charity Act.
application_process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Animal Husbandry Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the online application and submit it to the board within 30 days of application with the signature and stamp of the GGVB’s nodal officer of the concerned district with the necessary documents listed in the application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.﻿
documents_required: Copy of 7/12, 8-A, and 6-rights of own land.Copy of lease agreement (if land is leased).Certificate from the Talati of Gram Panchayat confirming availability of water resource.Any other documents as required.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the main objective of the "Scheme for Supply of Improved Seeds for Fodder"?The main objective of the scheme is to provide improved quality fodder seeds to registered Gaushalas and Panjarapols to ensure the availability of green fodder throughout the year, thereby improving livestock health and productivity.Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?Only Gaushalas and Panjarapols that are registered under the Public Charity Act are eligible to apply for this scheme.What types of fodder seeds are supplied under this scheme?The scheme supplies improved seeds of maize, sorghum, oats, and lucerne to the eligible institutions.﻿﻿What is the maximum quantity of seeds that can be availed under this scheme?Eligible institutions can receive up to 10 kits of maize (5 kg each), 50 kits of sorghum (5 kg each), 5 kits of oats (5 kg each), and 20 kits of lucerne (2 kg each).﻿﻿How often can an institution benefit from this scheme?An institution can avail the benefits of this scheme once every year.﻿﻿Is registration under any specific act necessary to apply?Yes, the applying institution must be registered under the Public Charity Act to be eligible.﻿﻿Can institutions with leased land apply for the scheme?Yes, institutions having a valid lease agreement for the land can also apply for the scheme.﻿﻿Can an institution apply for the scheme multiple times in a year?No, institutions can only avail the benefits of this scheme once per year.﻿﻿Where can eligible institutions apply for the scheme?Applications must be submitted online through the iKhedut portal, followed by submission of printed applications with signatures and required documents to the board.What documents must be submitted along with the application?Documents such as 7/12 extract, 8-A form, 6-rights record, lease agreement (if applicable), and a certificate from the Talati of Gram Panchayat confirming water availability are required.Within how many days must the application documents be submitted?The documents must be submitted to the board within 30 days of submitting the online application.

title: Mahila Nursery Yojana
details: The "Mahila Nursery Yojana" scheme was launched by the Department of Forest, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to empower women's groups through income generation by establishing plant nurseries. Under this scheme, high-quality, species-specific seeds and technical training are provided to self-help groups and local women to set up nurseries. Resources required for nursery operations are also funded via fixed grants. The plants grown in these nurseries are purchased by the Forest Department based on agreement.
benefits: High-quality species-wise seeds are provided to women’s groups.Financial support in the form of a fixed grant for nursery equipment and resources.Technical support and training for nursery management.Purchase of grown plants by the Forest Department based on experience and quality.Note: The department disburses the grant in installments directly into the self-help group's account upon the purchase of resources required for establishing the nursery.
eligibility: The applicant should be a registered Women Self-Help Group, Women Mangal Dal, or Local Women Group.The women's group should be operating within the state of Uttarakhand.The group should be registered with the concerned Divisional Forest Office.
application_process: OfflineStep 1: The applicant women's group should contact the concerned Divisional Forest Office for registration under the scheme.Step 2: The group should submit a proposal specifying the nursery location, along with the required documents for registration.Step 3: Upon verification, support is provided to the Women Self-Help Group under the scheme.Notes:A copy of the nursery manual and relevant technical information will be provided to the group for setting up the nursery.The department provides the grant in installments to the bank accounts of self-help groups for the essential materials used in setting up the nursery, which are purchased by the group.
documents_required: Group Registration Certificate (from Divisional Forest Officer)Khasra-Khatauni of Proposed Nursery SiteResolution of Group Meeting (approving nursery project)Aadhaar Card of Group RepresentativeBank Passbook Copy of Group AccountMobile Number of the Representative
frequently_asked_questions: Who can apply for the scheme?Registered SHGs, Mahila Mangal Dals, and local women’s groups in Uttarakhand.What is the objective of the scheme?To promote economic empowerment of women through plant nursery establishment.Is there any registration process?Yes, registration with the Divisional Forest Office is mandatory.What documents are required?Aadhaar card, bank passbook, Khasra-Khatauni, group resolution, etc.What type of support is provided?Seeds, technical training, financial assistance, and plant procurement.Is the grant given upfront?No, it is disbursed in installments.Can individuals apply for this scheme?No, only registered groups are eligible.Is technical support provided?Yes, the department offers manuals and on-ground training.How long does it take to receive the first installment?Typically, after verification and initial setup.Is there a helpline or office to contact?Yes, local Divisional Forest Officer offices act as the nodal point.

title: National Livestock Mission: Establishment of State Semen Bank
details: Launched in the Financial Year 2014-15, the scheme "National Livestock Mission" by the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying, aims towards employment generation, entrepreneurship development, increase in per animal productivity and thus targeting increased production of meat, goat milk, egg and wool. The excess production will help in the export earnings after meeting the domestic demands. The concept of the NLM Scheme is to develop the entrepreneur in order to create the forward and backward linkage for the produce available in the unorganized sector and to link with the organized sector.﻿"Establishment of State Semen Bank (Genetic Improvement of Sheep and Goat breeds)" is a component of the "Sub-mission on Breed Development of Livestock and Poultry" scheme of the National Livestock Mission. The objective of this component is the genetic improvement of sheep/goat breeds through selective breeding by propagation of superior male germplasm through artificial insemination. For propagation of Artificial Insemination Technology for goats through frozen semen, there will be a requirement of storage depot at the state level for onward supply of goat frozen semen to the AI centres. The State Semen Bank working for storing cattle and buffalo frozen semen can work as the semen bank for goats also. Therefore, one time assistance will be provided for strengthening the existing state semen bank for goat frozen semen storing by providing equipment and storing containers.
benefits: One-time assistance of up to ₹ 10,00,000/- will be provided to the state for strengthening of existing cattle and buffalo semen bank to store and distribute goat frozen semen.The assistance will be provided for procurement of equipment like cryo-container and other related equipment.
eligibility: The following entities are eligible -  State Livestock Agencies.Animal Husbandry Department, State Government.
application_process: OnlineStep 1: Visit the Official Website of "National Livestock Mission" and click "Apply Here".Step 2: The following methods of Logging In will be displayed:Login as EntrepreneurLogin as Government / Other AgenciesLogin as Research & InnovationLogin to the website using your preferred method.Step 3: On the next page, verify your Mobile Number via OTP. You will be taken to the Online Application Form. Step 4: In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size.Step 5: Agree to the "Declaration & Authorization" by ticking the checkbox. Provide the Date & Place, and finally click "Submit".Post-Application ProcessesStep 1: Screening of application by State Implementing Agency (SIA)SIA will scrutinize the submitted application and will recommend the application of the entrepreneurs/ eligible entities to avail balance financing for the project through scheduled banks or financial institutions like National Cooperative Development Corporation (NCDC) etc.Step 2: Loan sanction by LenderAfter the recommendation of the project by SIA, the same will be considered by the bank or financial institutions for financing. Lender will pick the application along with all the documents from the portal and will approve the loan after examining the project/ documents submitted by applicant and completing their internal deligent process. After sanctioning the loan, Lender will upload sanction letter on the portal.Step 3: Recommendation from State Level Executive Committee (SLEC)Once the bank or financial institution sanction the project, SIA shall place the same in SLEC for recommending the application to the Central Government (Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying).Step 4: Approval of subsidy by DAHDDAHD will approve the subsidy and will mark the approval of the same on portal.Step 5: Disbursement and release of subsidyAfter compliance of terms and conditions mentioned in the sanction letter, lender will disburse the loan amount to the beneficiary. fund the subsidy amount for the approved projects through Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) to the lending Bank or financial institutions as the case may be to release the subsidy to Beneficiaries.Track Application StatusYou can check your application status from the "TRACK STATUS" tab available in the upper right corner of the portalHelp and SupportIf you encounter any issues or have questions, visit the "Contact Us" page.
documents_required: A. Documents Related to ProjectDetailed project report (DPR)* including cost of project, means of finance, recurring cost, net income etc.Land document (Ownership / Lease deed/ Rent Agreement etc.)Photographs of project siteDocumentary proof of applicant’s share in the projectList of farmers linked/attached with applicant comprising Name, Aadhar Number, Mobile No. and AddressB. Documents Related to Applicant PAN card*GST registration certificateCertificate of Incorporation (In case of company)Partnership Deed (In case of partnership firm)Address Proof* (Election Commission Photo ID card, Electricity Bill, Water Bill, Telephone Bill, Passbook, rent agreement etc.)Last three years audited Annual financial statements, if applicableLast three years income tax returns, if applicableBank statement for last six monthsCanceled cheque along with bank mandate form*C. Documents Related to Key PromoterPAN Card*Aadhar Card*Address Proof * (Election Commission Photo ID card, Electricity Bill, Water Bill, Telephone Bill, Passbook, rent agreement etc.) Photograph*Caste certificate, if applicableEducation certificatesTraining certificatesExperience letter/ certificate about any livestock farming activities done earlier
frequently_asked_questions: What is the objective of this scheme?The objective is to genetically improve sheep and goat breeds through selective breeding by propagating superior male germplasm via artificial insemination.Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?Eligible entities include State Livestock Agencies and the Animal Husbandry Department of State Governments.What financial assistance is provided under this scheme?The scheme provides one-time assistance of up to Rs. 10 lakh for strengthening existing cattle and buffalo semen banks to store and distribute goat frozen semen. This assistance is 100% centrally funded.What are the key components of the project?Key components include strengthening the existing state semen bank by providing equipment like cryocontainers and other related equipment for storing goat frozen semen.What is the funding pattern for this scheme?The funding pattern is 100% central assistance for all States and Union Territories.What documents are required to apply for this scheme?Required documents include the application form, project proposal, identity proof, address proof, entity registration documents, bank account details, land ownership/lease documents (if applicable), technical specifications, detailed cost estimates, approval letters, environmental clearances (if applicable), a declaration form, and an Expression of Interest (EOI) from the state.What is the process for disbursement of funds?Funds are disbursed in a one-time assistance manner, released to the scheduled bank or financial institution upon approval by the State Implementing Agency.What equipment can be procured under this scheme?Equipment that can be procured includes cryo-containers and other related equipment necessary for the storage and distribution of goat frozen semen.Can this scheme be used for setting up new semen banks?No, this scheme is intended for strengthening existing cattle and buffalo semen banks to store and distribute goat frozen semen.Is recurring expenditure covered under this scheme?No, the scheme does not cover recurring expenditure for running the semen bank. The bank is expected to generate its own resources for operational expenses.What are the responsibilities of the State Implementing Agency?The State Implementing Agency is responsible for verifying the submitted documents, assessing project feasibility, disbursing funds, and conducting follow-up verification after project completion.Where can I get more information about the scheme?For more information, contact the State Implementing Agency or the Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying (DAHD), Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry, and Dairying (MoFAHD), Government of India. What is the purpose of the Expression of Interest (EOI)?The EOI from the state indicates their intent and readiness to strengthen the existing semen bank for storing and distributing goat frozen semen.What happens after the project is completed?After project completion, a final verification will be conducted to ensure adherence to the guidelines and successful strengthening of the state semen bank.
