title: Fish Extension, Research, and Training Scheme
details: The "Fish Extension, Research, and Training Scheme" by the Department of Fisheries, Government of India aims to promote sustainable fishing practices and enhance fish production through scientific research, extension, and skill development. Under this scheme, financial and technical assistance are provided to fish farmers, fishery extension workers, and others in the fisheries sector.
benefits: Training and Workshops:Fish Seed Producers: 3-day training with a subsidy of ₹225.50 per participant (excluding travel/accommodation).Fish Farmers/Stakeholders: Workshops with a subsidy of ₹1500.50 per participant (covering expenses and travel up to ₹600).Fish Production and Research:₹2,00,000/- for producing 5 tons of Pangasius fish.Support for research on new fish species and maintenance of labs/museums.Fish Seed Distribution:Subsidies for seed procurement of various fish species (e.g., Amur Carp, Tilapia).Incentives:Up to ₹30,000 for exemplary farmers, with awards in the form of equipment (e.g., aerators, oxygen cylinders).Identity Cards:Issuance of identity cards for 1,050 fishermen.Public Awareness:₹100 per day for Birsa Fish Farmers during workshops.Cage Fish Culture Support:Financial assistance for information collection and technical support.
eligibility: The applicant should be a registered fish farmer, fishery extension worker, or related entity in the fisheries sector.The applicant should have prior experience or relevant qualifications in the fisheries field.The applicant should be from a region identified under the scheme by the Department of Fisheries.Preference will be given to applicants from rural and underdeveloped areas.The applicant should have a valid bank account for fund disbursement.
application_process: OfflineApply after the advertisement is published:Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the District Fisheries Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Fisheries Office.Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Fisheries Office to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).
documents_required: Identity ProofBank Account DetailsRegistration Proof of Fish Farming (for farmers and fishery extension workers)Qualification Certificates (for applicants seeking training or research grants)Project Proposal (for infrastructure development or research funding)
frequently_asked_questions: Can fish farmers from rural areas apply for the scheme?Yes, preference is given to applicants from rural and underdeveloped areas, making it easier for rural fish farmers to apply.What kind of financial support is available under this scheme?The scheme provides financial support for training, infrastructure development, research projects, and technical consultations, disbursed either as grants or reimbursements.How do I know if I am eligible to apply for this scheme?Applicants must be involved in the fisheries sector (fish farmers, fishery extension workers) with prior experience or qualifications in the field.How can I apply for the training programs?Apply by registering on the official NFDB website and submitting an application with required documents like qualification certificates and project proposals.What documents do I need to provide when applying for this scheme?Required documents include identity proof, bank account details, fish farming registration, qualification certificates, and project proposals, if applicable.How are the funds disbursed to the beneficiaries?Funds are disbursed through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the applicant's bank account upon approval of the project or training.Can I apply for the research grant under this scheme?Yes, research institutions and universities can apply for research grants related to sustainable fish farming practices under this scheme.Can I apply for multiple types of assistance under this scheme?Yes, you can apply for more than one type of assistance, such as both training and infrastructure grants, if eligible.Is there any support available for the maintenance of infrastructure developed under the scheme?The scheme primarily offers financial assistance for infrastructure development, but ongoing maintenance is the responsibility of the applicant.Are there any special provisions for women or marginalized groups under this scheme?While the scheme does not mention specific provisions for women or marginalized groups, preference is given to rural areas, which may include these communities.Where can I find more information or resolve issues regarding my application?For more details or any grievances, you can visit the official NFDB website or contact the District Fisheries Office.

title: Scheme of Assistance for Environment Protection Measures: Scheme for assistance to Environment Management
details: The "Scheme of Assistance for Environment Protection Measures" is an umbrella scheme launched by the Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat under the Gujarat Industrial Policy. Effective from August 7th, 2020 to August 6th, 2025, this initiative promotes sustainable industrial growth by supporting industries in adopting eco-friendly practices and ensuring compliance with environmental norms.The component "Scheme for Assistance to Environment Management" is designed to promote the adoption of cleaner production technologies and advanced pollution control equipment to improve environmental management. It aims to optimize raw material use, reduce energy and water consumption, and minimize waste generation in industries.
benefits: ﻿Eligible ActivityQuantum of Assistance per project 1. Implementation of cleaner production technology in place of existing processes such as substitution and optimization of raw materials, reduction water consumption or energy consumption, or waste generation1. Upto 35% of the cost of plant and machinery with a ceiling of ₹35,00,000/- during the operative period of the scheme for MSME.        2. Upto 10% of the cost of plant and machinery with a ceiling of ₹35,00,000/- during the operative period of the scheme for large projects.2. Any other environment management project with the use of Clean, Efficient, and Innovative Pollution Control Equipment1. Upto 25% of the cost of plant and machinery with a ceiling of ₹35,00,000/- during the operative period of the scheme for MSME.                    2. Upto 10% of the cost of plant and machinery with a ceiling of ₹35,00,000/- during the operative period of the scheme for large projects.﻿Sanctioning Authority: Assistance under the scheme will be sanctioned by State Level Empowered Committee and assistance will be disbursed by Industries Commissionerate.
eligibility: The industry/unit must be registered under relevant industrial laws in Gujarat.The industry/unit must comply with existing environmental regulations and standards.The industry/unit must be engaged in manufacturing or production activities.The industry/unit must undertake projects focused on environmental protection measures.
application_process: OfflineStep-1: The applicant enterprise has to fill out the prescribed application form.Step-2: Attach all relevant documents as required under the scheme guidelines.Step-3: Submit the completed application form and documents to the Industries Commissionerate or the concerned District Industries Centre.Step-4: Ensure that the application is submitted within six months from the date of completion of the activity or project.
documents_required: Copy of the Constitution of Enterprise.Project Completion Certificate/ Commissioning Certificate with project completion date.Expenditure statement approved by Chartered Accountant in prescribed proforma as per Annexure ES1.Justification of the comparative benefits of the implemented project with details of data and % reduction in raw material/ water/ energy consumption or waste generation.Copy of EM registration/ IEM Part-B/ Udyog Aadhaar Memorandum (UAM)/ Udyam Registration (UR) (as the case may be).GPCB NOC/CCA for the project.Process Diagram with brief note on existing and new technology adopted for the project.Last year balance sheet of enterprise.Bank statements for expenditures incurred in the project.Photographs of Project (minimum 3 photographs).Copy of any other financial assistance granted by GoG and/or GoI for the same component/project (if not granted, then give undertaking).Undertaking for outstanding Government dues and any pending court case against the government.
frequently_asked_questions:
What is the "Scheme for Assistance for Environment Protection Measures"?The "Scheme of Assistance for Environment Protection Measures" under the Gujarat Industrial Policy promotes sustainable industrial growth by supporting industries in adopting eco-friendly practices and ensuring compliance with environmental norms, effective from August 7th, 2020 to August 6th, 2025.What is the purpose of the "Scheme of Assistance for Environment Protection Measures" component?The "Scheme of Assistance for Environment Protection Measures" component aims to promote sustainable industrial growth by supporting industries in adopting eco-friendly practices and complying with environmental norms.


Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?Industries or units registered under relevant industrial laws in Gujarat and engaged in manufacturing or production activities are eligible to apply.


What types of projects are supported under the scheme?Projects involving cleaner production technologies, pollution control equipment, and other environmental protection measures are supported.


What is the maximum financial assistance provided under the scheme?Financial assistance varies depending on the project type and size, with a ceiling of ₹35,00,000/- per project.


What is the deadline for submitting an application?Applicants must submit their applications within six months from the date of completion of the activity or project.


Where should the application be submitted?Applications should be submitted to the Industries Commissionerate or the concerned District Industries Centre.


Can an applicant apply for assistance for multiple projects?Yes, an applicant can apply for assistance for multiple projects, provided each meets the scheme's eligibility criteria.


Are there any restrictions on the type of industries that can apply?Only industries compliant with environmental regulations and located in Gujarat are eligible; industries with significant environmental violations are ineligible.


How is the assistance amount determined?The assistance amount is based on the cost of the proposed project, subject to the prescribed percentage and ceiling limits.


Can large enterprises apply for this scheme?Yes, large enterprises are eligible, though the quantum of assistance is lower compared to MSMEs.


What role does the Industries Commissionerate play in the scheme?The Industries Commissionerate is responsible for receiving, reviewing, and approving applications under the scheme.

title: Scheme of Assistance for Environment Protection Measures: Scheme for assistance to encouraging Green Practices and Environmental Audit to MSMEs
details: The "Scheme of Assistance for Environment Protection Measures" is an umbrella scheme launched by the Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat under the Gujarat Industrial Policy. Effective from August 7th, 2020 to August 6th, 2025, this initiative promotes sustainable industrial growth by supporting industries in adopting eco-friendly practices and ensuring compliance with environmental norms.The component "Scheme for Assistance to Encourage Green Practices and Environmental Audit for MSMEs" is designed to promote green practices and environmental sustainability in MSMEs by providing financial support for activities such as environmental audits, installation of monitoring systems, and adopting eco-friendly infrastructure.
benefits: ﻿Eligible ActivityQuantum of Assistance per Project Periodic Environmental AuditsUp to 75% of fees with a ceiling of ₹50,000/- per audit.Installation of Monitoring SystemsUp to 25% of fees with a ceiling of ₹5,00,000/- per audit.Green Building CertificationUp to 50% of fees with a ceiling of ₹2,50,000/- per audit.Environmental Management SystemsUp to 50% of fees with a ceiling of ₹10,00,000/- per audit.Cluster-Based Equipment PurchaseUp to 35% of fees with a ceiling of ₹35,00,000/- per audit.Wastewater Recovery SystemsUp to 50% of fees with a ceiling of ₹75,00,000/- per audit.﻿
eligibility: The industry/unit must be registered under relevant industrial laws in Gujarat.The industry/unit must comply with existing environmental regulations and standards.The industry/unit must be engaged in manufacturing or production activities.The industry/unit must undertake projects focused on environmental protection measures.The industry/unit must adopt green practices as specified in the scheme.
application_process: OfflineStep-1: The applicant enterprise has to fill out the prescribed application form.Step-2: Attach all relevant documents as required under the scheme guidelines.Step-3: submit the claim with all relevant documents and details of expenditure to the concerned DIC (for Activities 1, 2 &3)/Industries Commissionerate office (for Activities 4, 5 & 6) and disbursement of the assistance will be made as per availability of grant.Step-4: Ensure that the application is submitted within six months from the date of completion of the activity or project.Contact Us:Jt. Commissioner of Industries (IM)Block No. 1, 4thFloor, Udyog Bhavan, Sector 11, Gandhinagar-382 011Ph. : +91 79 23252619,23252689, 23252682E-mail : icim@gujarat.gov.in; icjciim@gujarat.gov.in; icioim@gujarat.gov.in﻿
documents_required: Detailed Project Report for the project.Chartered Accountant Certificate for the expenditure.Expenditure statement approved by Chartered Accountant in prescribed pro forma.Justification of the comparative benefits of the implemented project with details of data and percentage reduction in raw material, water, energy consumption, or waste generation. (By maintaining the log sheet.)SLEC or GPCB approved independent empaneled auditor’s Environment Audit report (if applicable, otherwise justification for not applicable).Copy of the Constitution/Establishment of the Institute/Company. (Attach a copy of Registration Certificate.)Copy of EM registration/IEM Part-B/Udyog Aadhaar Memorandum (UAM)/Udyam Registration (UR) - (as the case may be).GPCB NOC/Consent.Process Flow Diagram with a brief note of the existing and proposed project.Last year balance sheet of the enterprise.Copies of invoices for which expenditure incurred for the project.Bank statements for expenditure incurred in the project.Photographs of the project (minimum 3 photographs).Rating certificate (for Scheme No. 3).Copy of any other financial assistance granted by GoG and/or GoI for the same component/project. (If not granted, then give undertaking.)Undertaking for outstanding Government dues and any pending court case against the government.
frequently_asked_questions:
What is the "Scheme for Assistance for Environment Protection Measures"?The "Scheme of Assistance for Environment Protection Measures" under the Gujarat Industrial Policy promotes sustainable industrial growth by supporting industries in adopting eco-friendly practices and ensuring compliance with environmental norms, effective from August 7th, 2020 to August 6th, 2025.What is the purpose of the "Scheme for Assistance to Encourage Green Practices and Environmental Audit for MSMEs" component?The "Scheme for Assistance to Encourage Green Practices and Environmental Audit for MSMEs" component aims to encourage MSMEs to adopt green practices, improve environmental compliance, and implement eco-friendly measures.


Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?Existing MSMEs that intend to adopt green practices and meet the scheme’s criteria are eligible to apply.


Are newly established MSMEs eligible for this scheme?No, as per the guidelines only existing MSMEs can apply under this scheme.


What types of activities are covered under this scheme?The scheme supports activities such as voluntary environmental audits, installation of monitoring systems, green building certifications, setting up environmental management systems, and wastewater recovery systems.


Can MSMEs receive assistance for mandatory environmental audits?No, the scheme only provides assistance for voluntary environmental audits not mandated by law or court orders.


What is the maximum assistance available for wastewater recovery systems?MSMEs can receive up to 50% of the capital cost or ₹75,00,000/-, whichever is less, for wastewater recovery systems.


Can a cluster of industries apply for assistance?Yes, a cluster of at least 10 industries can apply for assistance to purchase common safety or environmental compliance equipment.


How is the subsidy disbursed to the applicant?The subsidy is disbursed by the DIC or IC office after the approval process, based on the availability of grants.


Does the scheme support green building certifications?Yes, the scheme provides financial support for obtaining green building certifications under IGBC, LEED, or GRIHA.


Can MSMEs apply for multiple activities under the scheme?Yes, MSMEs can apply for multiple activities as long as they meet the eligibility criteria for each activity.What is the deadline for submitting an application?Applications must be submitted within six months of completing the activity or project.

How is the approval process conducted?Applications for Activities 1, 2, and 3 are approved by the DIC, while applications for Activities 4, 5, and 6 are reviewed by the State Level Empowered Committee.

title: Scheme of Assistance for Common Environment Infrastructure: Financial Assistance for Common Environmental Infrastructure Facilities
details: The scheme "Scheme of Assistance for Common Environment Infrastructure" is an umbrella scheme launched by the Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat under the Gujarat Industrial Policy. Effective from August 7th, 2020 to August 6th, 2025, it aims to boost industrial growth through financial assistance, modern technologies, and enhanced facilities for industrial parks and clusters.The component “Financial Assistance for Common Environmental Infrastructure Facilities” aims to support industries and organizations in establishing and upgrading environmental management infrastructure. It provides financial aid for projects that promote pollution control, waste management, and environmental sustainability.
benefits: General Projects: Up to 40% financial assistance, with a maximum limit of ₹50,00,00,000/-.Government Projects: Assistance up to 80% for Government Departments, Agencies, PSUs, and Boards, with a ₹50,00,00,000/-.Co-Funding with GoI: Total assistance from GoI + GoG is limited to 75%, with 25% contribution from the institution.
eligibility: Industries association / Any Enterprise (except for captive use) or firm which is registered under Societies Act, Trust Act or under the Companies Act.; or GIDC/Board/ Corporations / Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) / PSU / Municipal Corporation / Nagarpalika / Urban Development Authority etc.The project must comply with Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEF) & Gujarat Pollution Control Board (GPCB) regulations.The project must remain operational for a minimum of 5 years post-completion.﻿
exclusions: The Project availing incentives under this scheme will not be entitled to avail incentives under any other scheme of the State Government for the same component, unless specified otherwise. However, the project will be eligible to avail incentives available under schemes of Government of India or any other institutions.The following investments are not eligible for financial assistance:Land purchaseLand developmentPreliminary expensesPre-operative expensesConsultancy fees
application_process: OfflineStep 1: Prepare a Detailed Project Report (DPR).Step 2: Fill out the prescribed application form.Step 3: Submit the application with the required documents to the Industries Commissionerate.Step 4: Await evaluation and approval from the State Level Empowered Committee. If approved, assistance will be disbursed in phases based on project progress.Helpdesk: Contact Here﻿
documents_required: Copy of legal status of applicant such as memorandum and article of association and company registration certificate or registration under society act or trust act, and list of directors/members with addresses.Proof that land for project is in possession, like land allotment letter of GIDC with copies of 7/12 utaara, N.A. permission, approved plan, and construction permission by competent authority.Copy of GPCB NOC/CCA for establishing project (if not applicable, then give justification on letterhead).Copy of Environment Clearance (if not applicable, then give justification on letterhead).Detailed project report covering all details mentioned in application form.List of beneficiaries in format as per Annexure-A1 for each beneficiary on letterhead.Process diagram of proposed project signed by authorized signatory.Financial and technical appraisal of project from Bank/FI/other institution as approved by SLEC.Copy of any other financial assistance granted by GoG and/or GoI for the same component or project.Copy of sanction/consent letter from Financial Institution, if loan is sanctioned.Affidavits for outstanding government dues and any pending court case against Govt.Declaration/resolution as per application.
frequently_asked_questions:
What is the objective of the "Scheme of Assistance for Common Environment Infrastructure"?The scheme "Scheme of Assistance for Common Environment Infrastructure" under the Gujarat Industrial Policy aims to provide incentives for environmental compliance to ensure long-term economic and ecological balance.


What is the objective of the "Financial Assistance for Common Environmental Infrastructure Facilities" component?The scheme aims to provide financial support for the establishment and upgradation of environmental infrastructure to promote pollution control, waste management, and sustainable industrial practices.

Who can apply for financial assistance under this scheme?Industries, industrial associations, government agencies, public sector undertakings (PSUs), and other eligible institutions involved in environmental management can apply for assistance.


What types of projects are eligible for assistance under this scheme?Eligible projects include Common Effluent Treatment Plants (CETPs), waste recycling plants, hazardous waste incinerators, solvent recovery units, environmental monitoring systems, and other approved environmental infrastructure projects.


What is the maximum financial assistance available under this scheme?The scheme provides assistance of up to 40% of the eligible fixed capital investment, with a maximum limit of ₹50,00,00,000/-. For government projects, assistance can go up to 80%, subject to approval.


Can a project receive financial assistance from both the State Government and the Central Government?Yes, if a project qualifies for assistance under a Central Government scheme, the total assistance (GoI + GoG) is limited to 75%, with the remaining 25% to be borne by the applicant.


What kind of expenses are considered eligible for financial assistance?Expenses incurred on fixed capital investment such as land, plant, machinery, technology upgradation, automation, and infrastructure development are eligible for assistance under this scheme.


Are there any restrictions on availing assistance under other state government schemes?Yes, projects receiving assistance under this scheme cannot avail incentives from any other state government scheme for the same component unless specified otherwise. However, they can receive incentives under schemes of the Government of India or other institutions.


What happens if an applicant fails to comply with environmental regulations?If an institution violates environmental laws or conditions set by the Gujarat Pollution Control Board (GPCB), the government may take over the project, restructure the board, or recover the financial assistance as arrears of land revenue with an 8% interest rate.


How long does an approved project need to remain operational?The project must remain operational for a minimum of 5 years after its commencement to ensure sustainable environmental benefits.


What are the reporting requirements for an approved project?Institutions must submit quarterly progress reports, data on project operations, and utilization certificates for the assistance disbursed by the government.


Is it mandatory for an institution to obtain ISO-14001 certification?Yes, the institution must obtain ISO-14001 certification within two years after project completion and ensure its periodic renewal.


How is the financial assistance disbursed?Up to 95% of the sanctioned amount is reimbursed based on eligible expenditure and assets created, while the remaining 5% is disbursed after submission of a project completion certificate and ISO-14001 certification.

title: Scheme to Provide Assistance to Processing Units in State Market Committees
details: The scheme "Scheme to Provide Assistance to Processing Units in State Market Committees" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial aid to market committees in Gujarat to establish food processing units. These units will help in cleaning, grading, packaging, and branding agricultural produce.
benefits: ﻿ComponentStandard of AssistanceTo create facilities for processing/ grading/ cleaning / washing /shorting/ packaging/ branding, and valuation at State Market Committee level50% of project cost to all types of market committees up to a limit of ₹1,50,00,000/-.﻿
eligibility: All market committees in Gujarat are eligible to apply.﻿
application_process: OfflineStep 1: he market committee must prepare a development plan and obtain an estimate from an engineer approved by the Director of Agricultural Markets and Rural Finance, Gujarat State, Gandhinagar.Step 2: The proposal must be submitted through the Deputy Director and District Registrar Co-operative Societies of the respective district.Office Address and Contact Details of District Registrar: Click here.
documents_required: Proposal for development work.Estimate from an approved engineer.Undertaking by the market committee.Any other documents as required.﻿
frequently_asked_questions:
What is the objective of the scheme?The scheme aims to provide financial assistance for the development of specific facilities, ensuring improved services and infrastructure.

Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?Any entity that meets the specified eligibility criteria mentioned in the scheme guidelines can apply.

What kind of financial assistance is provided under the scheme?The scheme provides 50% of the project cost, up to ₹1,50,00,000/-.

What types of projects or activities are covered under the scheme?The scheme covers projects such as infrastructure development, processing, branding, packaging, or any other specified activities outlined in the guidelines.

Will the government verify the project implementation after approval?Yes, the government may conduct inspections or monitoring to ensure proper implementation and utilization of funds.

What documents are required to apply for the scheme?The applicant needs to submit relevant documents such as a project proposal, cost estimates, approval certificates, and any other required supporting documents.

How can an applicant submit the application for this scheme?The applicant must prepare and submit the proposal as per the prescribed process through the designated authorities mentioned in the application guidelines.

Is there a deadline for applying to the scheme?Yes, the scheme follows a specified timeline, and applicants must submit their proposals before the deadline mentioned in the official notification.

title: Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries
details: The scheme "Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, is designed to boost inland fisheries by supporting Scheduled Caste fishermen and fish farmers. It provides assistance for fish seed rearing, stocking, and transportation, as well as financial aid for boats, nets, and fish sale equipment. Additionally, training programs with stipends are available to enhance skills and productivity in the fisheries sector.
benefits: ﻿Name of ComponentStandard of AssistanceMinimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming BenefitsFish Seed Rearing₹90/- per 1000 spawn to fry (30% recovery); ₹260/- per 1000 fry to fingerlings (35% recovery); ₹460/- per 1000 spawn to fingerlings (12% recovery); Rearing time: 30, 60, 90 days1 YearFish Seed Stocking100% assistance for fish seed and transportation cost1 YearPrawn Seed Stocking100% assistance for prawn seed and transportation cost for Scheduled Caste lessees1 YearBoat & Net50% assistance for Tin Boat & Net (₹15,000/- or ₹7,500/-, whichever is less); 50% assistance for F.R.P Boat & Net (₹30,000/- or ₹15,000/-, whichever is less)6 YearsFish Collection & Patrolling BoatFish Collection Boat: ₹5,00,000/- unit cost, 75% assistance (₹3.75 lakh/- or 75% of purchase price); Four-wheel Transport Vehicle: ₹6,00,000/- unit cost, 75% subsidy (₹4.50 lakh/- or 75% of purchase price); Three-wheel Transport Vehicle: ₹2,00,000/- unit cost, 75% subsidy (₹1.50 lakh/- or 75% of purchase price)Once in a lifetimeScheme for fish sale equipments50% subsidy of total unit purchase cost (₹15,000/- or ₹7,500/-) Includes:                                                        Insulated box (₹1,000/-), Box (₹500/-), Renkadi (₹5,000/-), Weighing unit (₹1,000/-)Once in a lifetimeTraining of Scheduled Caste trainees₹1,250/- stipend after 10-day training; ₹125/- per day during trainingOnce in a lifetime﻿
eligibility: Individuals/ societies/ self-help groups/ associations/ reservoir monopolies/ private units etc. involved in inland fisheries activities can avail the benefits of inland schemes.The applicant should be a Fisherman.The applicant should belong to the Schedule Caste(SC) category.Applicant should be above 18 years of age.The beneficiary fisherman must have his own bank account.
application_process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.
documents_required: Aadhar card.Quotation.Caste certificate.Passport size photo.Bank passbook/ cancelled cheque.Ration card.
frequently_asked_questions:
What is the objective of the "Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries" scheme?The objective of the "Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries" scheme is to increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and to provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Caste (SC) individuals involved in inland fisheries.


Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?Individuals, societies, self-help groups, associations, reservoir monopolies, and private units engaged in inland fisheries can apply. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category, be above 18 years of age, and have a valid bank account.


Can a Scheduled Tribe (ST) individual apply for this scheme?No, this scheme is exclusively for Scheduled Caste (SC) individuals involved in inland fisheries.


What financial assistance is provided for fish seed rearing?The scheme provides the following assistance for fish seed rearing:

₹90/- per 1000 spawn to fry (30% recovery).
₹260/- per 1000 fry to fingerlings (35% recovery).
₹460/- per 1000 spawn to fingerlings (12% recovery).Is there any support provided for fish seed stocking?Yes, 100% assistance is provided for the cost of fish seed and transportation for Scheduled Caste (SC) beneficiaries.


Does the scheme offer support for prawn seed stocking?Yes, 100% assistance is provided to Scheduled Caste (SC) lessees for the total cost of prawn seed and transportation.


What assistance is available for purchasing boats and nets?50% assistance is provided for the Tin Boat & Net (up to ₹7,500/-).
50% assistance is provided for the F.R.P. Boat & Net (up to ₹15,000/-).Can the benefits of this scheme be availed more than once?Some benefits, such as boat and net assistance and training, can be availed only once in a lifetime, while fish seed and prawn seed stocking can be availed annually.


What is the minimum time limit for reclaiming benefits?The minimum time limit varies:

Fish seed rearing & stocking: 1 year.
Boat & net assistance: 6 years.
Fish collection and patrolling boat: Once in a lifetime.How can an applicant apply for this scheme?The applicant must apply online through the i-Khedut portal (https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in) and upload the necessary documents.

title: To Increase Fish Seed Production and Inland Fisheries Equipment in Non-Tribal Areas
details: The scheme "To Increase Fish Seed Production and Inland Fisheries Equipment in Non-Tribal Areas" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to enhance fish seed production and promote inland fisheries in non-tribal areas. It provides financial assistance for fish farming, fish seed rearing, and procurement of essential fisheries equipment, benefiting individuals, societies, and self-help groups involved in inland fisheries.
benefits: ﻿Component NameStandard of Assistance	Minimum Time Limit for Reclaiming BenefitsFish Seed Rearing	₹90/- per 1000 (spawn to fry) ₹260/- per 1000 (fry to fingerlings) ₹460/- per 1000 (spawn to fingerlings)	1 YearFish Seed/Prawn Seed Stocking	50% subsidy on cost and transportation	1 YearBoat & Net Assistance	50% subsidy up to ₹7,500/- for Tin Boat-Net, ₹15,000/- for FRP Boat-Net	6 YearsAssistance to Backward Women for Fish Sale Equipment	50% subsidy up to ₹7,500/-	Once in a LifetimePlastic Crates	50% subsidy up to ₹600/- per unit	5 YearsAerator Assistance	50% subsidy up to ₹50,000/-	5 YearsFish Collection cum Patrolling Boat	50% subsidy up to ₹2,50,000/-	Once in a LifetimeInsulated Box	50% subsidy, up to ₹15,000/-	5 YearsFish Cage Culture	40% subsidy (General) up to ₹1,20,000/- 60% subsidy (SC/ST) up to ₹1,80,000/-	3 YearsAssistance to Pagadia Fishermen	90% subsidy up to ₹13,500/-	3 YearsNew Fish Pond Construction	40% subsidy (General) up to ₹2,80,000/- 60% (SC/ST) up to ₹4,20,000/-	Once in a LifetimeInput Assistance	40% subsidy (General) up to ₹60,000/- 60% (SC/ST) up to ₹90,000/-	Once in a LifetimeMobile Laboratory Van	50% subsidy up to ₹5,00,000/-	Once in a LifetimeFish Seed Hatchery	50% subsidy up to ₹12,50,000/-	Once in a Lifetime﻿
eligibility: Individuals/ societies/ self-help groups/ associations/ reservoir monopolies/ private units etc. involved in inland fisheries activities can avail the benefits of inland schemes.The applicant should be a Fisherman.Applicant should be above 18 years of age.Applicant must have own private land/leased land to avail new pond construction assistance for fish farming (In case of two or more land holders consent form of other land holders must be submitted).The beneficiary fisherman must have his own bank account.
application_process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.
documents_required: Aadhaar card.Land details.Caste certificate.Passport size photo.Bank passbook/cancelled cheque.Ration card.
frequently_asked_questions:
What is the objective of this scheme?This scheme aims to enhance fish seed production and promote inland fisheries in non-tribal areas through providing financial assistance for fish farming, fish seed rearing, and procurement of essential fisheries equipment, benefiting individuals, societies, and self-help groups involved in inland fisheries.Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?Individuals, societies, self-help groups, associations, and private units engaged in inland fisheries activities are eligible to apply for the scheme.


What is the age requirement for applicants?The applicant must be above 18 years of age to be eligible for the scheme.


Can women avail benefits under this scheme?Yes, women, including those from Scheduled Caste (SC), Scheduled Tribe (ST), and Other Backward Class (OBC) categories, are eligible for benefits under the scheme.


What financial assistance is provided for fish pond construction?General category beneficiaries receive 40% subsidy up to ₹2,80,000/-, while SC/ST beneficiaries receive 60% subsidy up to ₹4,20,000/- per hectare.


Is it mandatory to have private or leased land for fish farming?Yes, applicants must have private or leased land to avail assistance for new pond construction. In cases where multiple landowners are involved, a consent form from all landowners must be submitted.


How much subsidy is available for purchasing boats and nets?Beneficiaries can receive a 50% subsidy up to ₹7,500/- for Tin Boat-Net and up to ₹15,000/- for FRP Boat-Net.


How can an applicant apply for the scheme?Applications can be submitted online through the ikhedut portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in, along with the necessary documents.


Can multiple landowners jointly apply for assistance?Yes, multiple landowners can apply, but they must submit a consent form from all landowners involved in the project.

title: A Scheme to Provide Assistance for Building E-Market Facilities in Market Committees
details: "A Scheme to Provide Assistance for Building E-Market Facilities in Market Committees" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support market committees to set up e-market facilities, enhancing transparency and efficiency in agricultural marketing across the state.
benefits: Financial Assistance: ₹1,00,000/- (One Lakh Rupees) per eligible market committee.﻿﻿
eligibility: Co-operative Market Committees shall be eligible under this scheme.The committee must operate within Gujarat.
application_process: OfflineStep 1: Fill in the application form on plain paper as per the instructions.Step 2: Attach all required documents.Step 3: Submit the completed application to the District Registrar for processing.
documents_required: Proof of cooperative market committee registration.Details of the proposed e-market facility setup.Any other documents as required.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the objective of the "A Scheme to Provide Assistance for Building E-Market Facilities in Market Committees"?The objective of the scheme is to provide financial support to cooperative market committees in Gujarat for establishing digital e-market (e-NAM) facilities under the National Agriculture Market Policy.﻿﻿Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?Only registered cooperative market committees operating within the state of Gujarat are eligible to apply for this scheme.﻿﻿How much financial assistance is provided under the scheme?Under the scheme, each eligible market committee is granted a financial assistance of ₹1,00,000/- (One Lakh Rupees).﻿﻿Is there any fee for obtaining or submitting the application form?No, there is no fee required for obtaining or submitting the application form; it is completely free of cost.﻿﻿Can private companies or individuals apply for the scheme?No, only cooperative market committees are eligible to apply; private entities or individuals are not eligible.﻿﻿Is the scheme applicable outside Gujarat?No, the scheme is limited to cooperative market committees located within the state of Gujarat.﻿﻿Is online application available for this scheme?No, currently, there is no provision for submitting applications online; applications must be submitted physically to the District Registrar.﻿﻿Which department is responsible for implementing the scheme?The Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation, Government of Gujarat, is responsible for implementing the scheme.

title: Package for strengthening to sugar co-operatives as may be policy decided by the State Government
details: The scheme "Package for strengthening to sugar co-operatives as may be policy decided by the State Government" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial aid to sugar co-operative societies for projects such as modernization, upgradation, tissue culture labs, molasses-based distilleries, storage system improvements, and cost reduction initiatives. It also offers direct assistance to farmers for the sale of bio-compost, phospho-compost, and vermicompost.
benefits: ﻿Name of the ComponentStandard of AssistanceA project to provide direct assistance to farmers' accounts by sugar cooperatives against sale of bio-compost by sugar cooperatives.₹100/- per metric ton against the total metric ton sales of bio compost volume. or a maximum of ₹20,00,000/- whichever is lessA project to provide direct assistance to the account of farmers through sugar cooperative societies against the sale of 50 kg bags of phospho compost by sugar cooperative societies.₹100/- per bag against the sale of a total bag of 50 kg of phosphor compost. or a maximum of ₹20,00,000/- whichever is lessA project to provide direct assistance to farmers' accounts by sugar cooperatives against purchase/sale of produce of 50 kg bags of vermicompost by sugar cooperatives.₹50/- per bag against the sale of a total bag of 50 kg of vermin Compost or maximum ₹6,50,000/- whichever is less.Project for setting up of new tissue culture labs by sugar co-operative societies50% of the project cost or a maximum of ₹40,00,000/- whichever is less Project for extension of existing labs (other than civil works) to sugar cooperatives having tissue culture labs.50% of the project cost or a maximum of ₹20,00,000/- whichever is lessInstallation of electricity motor instead of turbine, construction of new tank for molasses/rectified spirit storage, mechanization in sugar harvesting, distillery capacity upgradation, increase in ethanol storage capacity, new godown construction, steam economy project, boiler modification, 3 MW turbine etc. Among all these projects, any one project to be done by the organization considering the priority25 % of project cost Or a maximum of ₹1,00,00,000/- whichever is less﻿
eligibility: Sugar Co-operative Societies, Members/Farmers of Sugar Co-operative Societies will be eligible for this scheme.
application_process: OfflineThe concerned sugar co-operative societies who are eligible, should send the proposal through the District Registrar of the concerned district to the Director of Sugar, Gujarat State, Gandhinagar.﻿Office Address and Contact Details of District Registrar: Click here.Office Address and Contact Details of Director Of Sugar:Director of sugarAddress: Dr.Jivraj Mehta bhavan, Block No.8 ,2nd floor, GandhinagarPhone: 232-53437Email Us: directorsugar[at]gmail[dot]com﻿﻿
documents_required: Project-related detailsName of the project for financial assistanceUnit under the project to increase sugarcane production and productivity (show separate quantities for each unit and single IB)Expected number of beneficiaries (Bio Vermi, Horho, Tyru, and Single IB)Is the land owned? Copy of 7/12 land record extractIs it obtained or on lease?Sale price per unit shown under the agricultural projectTechnical opinion from Agricultural University and an authenticated certificate – certified copyFor infrastructure-based technical projects, has the government-approved engineer’s report been prepared with planning, design, and technical authentication? If yes, a certified copy of the approved engineer’s license is required.Expected benefits of the project (Increase in production, productivity, expansion, technical reasons, potential employment growth, possible increase in state revenue).Any other documents if required.
frequently_asked_questions:
What is the main objective of this scheme?The scheme aims to modernize sugar co-operatives, improve infrastructure, enhance productivity, and provide financial assistance for bio-compost, phospho-compost, and vermicompost sales.


Who is eligible to apply for financial assistance under this scheme?Only registered sugar co-operative societies and their farmer members are eligible to apply for financial assistance under this scheme.


What types of financial assistance are available under this scheme?The scheme provides financial assistance for compost sales, modernization projects, infrastructure development, tissue culture labs, and cost reduction initiatives in sugar co-operatives.


What is the maximum financial assistance provided for compost sales?1. ₹100/- per metric ton for bio-compost sales (maximum ₹20,00,000/-).
2. ₹100/- per 50 kg bag of phospho-compost (maximum ₹20,00,000/-).
3. ₹50/- per 50 kg bag of vermicompost (maximum ₹6,50,000/-).Is financial assistance available for setting up tissue culture labs?Yes, the scheme provides financial assistance of up to ₹40,00,000/- for setting up new tissue culture labs and up to ₹20,00,000/- for expanding existing labs.


Can a sugar co-operative society apply for assistance for multiple projects?Yes, a sugar co-operative society can apply for multiple projects, but only one project will be considered based on priority and funding availability.


How is financial assistance disbursed to the beneficiaries?For compost-related projects, financial assistance is transferred directly to the farmers’ accounts. For other projects, funds are allocated to the sugar co-operative societies.


How can a sugar co-operative society apply for this scheme?The sugar co-operative society must submit a proposal through the District Registrar of the concerned district, which will then be forwarded to the Director of Sugar, Gujarat State, Gandhinagar, for approval.


Can an individual farmer apply directly for this scheme?No, individual farmers cannot apply directly. Only sugar co-operative societies can apply on behalf of their members.


Where can applicants get more information about the scheme?Applicants can contact the District Registrar of their respective district or the Director of Sugar, Gujarat State, Gandhinagar, for more information.

title: Construction of Dudhghar/ Godown (Scheduled Caste Area)
details: The scheme "Construction of Dudhghar/ Godown (Scheduled Caste Area)" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial support to Village Milk Producer Co-operative Societies in Scheduled Caste areas that lack their own milk storage or cattle feed storage infrastructure. It also promotes installation of bulk milk coolers and similar equipment.
benefits: Name of the ComponentStandard of assistanceRemarksMinimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming BenefitsDudhghar/ GodownUnit price (₹10,00,000/-)or actual expenditure occurs for construction, out of that 50% of whichever is less.Maximum ₹5,00,000/-Once in lifetime
eligibility: The Society must not already own a Dudhghar or Godown.The Society must have its own land available for the construction of the Dudhghar or Godown.The Society must not have availed of the benefit earlier under this or any other scheme for a similar purpose.
application_process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Animal Husbandry Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.Note: Required Documents can also be submitted in hard copies to the office mentioned in the application form within 7 days.
documents_required: Copy of Bank Passbook or cancelled cheque.Proof of own land for construction of Dudhghar/Godown.Certificate of not availing benefit earlier in same scheme/other scheme with similar purpose by Managing Director of Dairy Union.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the objective of the "Construction of Dudhghar/ Godown (Scheduled Caste Area)" scheme?The objective of the scheme is to support Village Milk Producer Co-operative Societies of Scheduled Caste area in constructing Dudhghars and Godowns to ensure hygienic milk production and proper storage of cattle feed.﻿﻿Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?Only Village Milk Producer Co-operative Societies located in Scheduled Caste areas of Gujarat are eligible to apply for the scheme.What financial assistance is provided under the scheme?The scheme provides financial assistance up to ₹5,00,000/- or 50% of the unit cost, whichever is less, for the construction of Dudhghar or Godown.﻿Is the benefit under the scheme provided more than once?No, the benefit under this scheme is provided only once in a lifetime to each eligible society.Can an individual dairy farmer apply for this scheme?No, individual dairy farmers are not eligible. Only registered Village Milk Producer Co-operative Societies can apply.Is it mandatory for the society to own land for construction?Yes, it is mandatory for the society to have its own land for the construction of the Dudhghar or Godown.How can a society apply for the scheme?The society can apply online through the iKhedut portal.Is document submission required after online application?Yes, the society must upload the required documents online or submit them in hard copy to the concerned office within 7 days of the online application.What documents are required for application?The required documents include a copy of the bank passbook or cancelled cheque, proof of land ownership, and a certificate from the Managing Director of the Dairy Union confirming that the benefit has not been availed earlier.What happens if the society has already received benefits under a similar scheme?If the society has already availed benefits under this or a similar scheme, it will not be eligible for assistance again.Is there a time limit for submitting documents after application?Yes, all required documents must be submitted within 7 days of completing the online application.Can the society install bulk milk coolers using this assistance?Yes, the financial assistance can be used for installing bulk milk coolers and similar equipment to support milk storage and hygiene.

title: Incentive Assistance to Scheduled Caste Farmers to Increase the Area, Production and Productivity of Sugarcane Farming
details: The scheme "Incentive Assistance to Scheduled Caste Farmers to Increase the Area, Production and Productivity of Sugarcane Farming" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support Scheduled Caste farmers by providing cash incentives for high-quality seeds, modern farming techniques, and agricultural mechanization. The scheme encourages farmers to enhance productivity and profitability.
benefits: ﻿Name of ComponentStandard of AssistanceMinimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming  BenefitsAssistance for sugarcane Sowing₹10,000/- per HectareEvery year10% assistance for excellent production10% extra benefit per metric ton for production exceeding 70 metric Tons/Hectares.Every yearNote: This scheme covers a cultivation area of 500 hectares of sugarcane for Scheduled Tribe farmers.
eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.The applicant must be from Gujarat state.The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe category.The applicant must be a householder.The farmer must be engaged in sugarcane cultivation.Farmers applying for the 10% incentive must demonstrate excellent production using high-quality seeds, agricultural inputs, and modern farming practices.
application_process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8:  Printout of the online application should be, signed/thumbprinted, and necessary documents submitted at the concerned office.Step 9:Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx﻿Contact Us: Click here.Note: Mandatory Registration: In the application, the farmer must specify the name of the Sugar Co-operative Society where they want to register their sugarcane crop cultivation in their district.Approval Process: Applications are verified and approved by the competent authority based on eligibility.Communication of Approval: Selected applicants will be notified via SMS, email, or written communication.Field Verification: Random verification of sugarcane cultivation is conducted by District Extension Staff.Fund Disbursement: Once approved, the assistance amount is directly transferred to the farmer’s bank account through the nodal agency.
documents_required: Caste Certificate.8-A Copy (Land ownership document).Bank Passbook and Cancelled Cheque.Aadhaar Card Copy.Undertaking Form (in case of joint ownership).Physical Disability Certificate (if applicable).
frequently_asked_questions:
What is the objective of this scheme?The primary objective of the scheme is to enhance the area, production, and productivity of sugarcane cultivation among Scheduled Caste farmers. Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?Scheduled Caste farmers who are engaged in sugarcane cultivation are eligible to apply for this scheme.

What financial assistance is provided under the scheme?Farmers receive ₹10,000/- per hectare for sugarcane cultivation. Additionally, those who produce more than 70 metric tons per hectare are eligible for an extra 10% incentive per metric ton.

How is the 10% incentive calculated?Farmers who produce more than 70 metric tons per hectare receive an additional 10% incentive based on the sale price of their extra production.

Who verifies the farmer’s sugarcane cultivation?The District Extension Staff conducts random field verification to ensure that sugarcane is cultivated as claimed in the application.

How will the farmer receive the assistance amount?The approved amount is directly credited to the farmer’s bank account through the nodal agency.

What if a farmer has joint land ownership?Farmers with joint land ownership must submit an Undertaking Form along with their application.

How can a farmer apply for the scheme?Farmers must apply online through the I-Khedut portal, take a printout of the application, sign/thumbprint it, and submit it along with the required documents to the concerned office.

What documents are required for application?Applicants must submit a Caste Certificate, 8-A Copy (land ownership document), Aadhaar Card, Bank Passbook, Cancelled Cheque, and an Undertaking Form (in case of joint ownership).

What happens after submitting the application?The application is verified by the concerned authorities, and eligibility is determined. Approved applications are forwarded to the Sugar Co-operative Society for further processing.

Where can farmers get more information about the scheme?Farmers can visit the I-Khedut portal or contact their local agricultural office for more details regarding the scheme.

title: Atma Nirbhar Pashu Palan Yojana
details: The scheme "Atma Nirbhar Pashu Palan Yojna (ANPPY)", implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry, Veterinary & Dairy Development, Government of Arunachal Pradesh, aims to enhance rural livelihoods, promote sustainable animal husbandry practices, and contribute to self-reliance in the livestock sector. Under this scheme, financial assistance in the form of credit-linked support is provided to unemployed individuals, Self-Help Groups (SHGs), farmers' clubs, cooperative societies, and Dairy Cooperative Societies (DCS) for livestock rearing and allied activities.
benefits: Under this scheme, financial assistance in the form of credit-linked support is provided to eligible beneficiaries for livestock rearing and allied activities.
eligibility: The following beneficiaries are eligible under this scheme:Arunachal State Rural Livelihoods Mission (ArSRLM) promoted Self-Help Groups (SHGs), individuals, Farmers' Clubs, Registered Cooperative Societies, and Dairy Cooperative Societies (DCS) will be eligible.Individuals should belong to the Arunachal Pradesh Scheduled Tribe (APST) category and be unemployed.
application_process: OnlineInterested and eligible students need to apply online on the Atma Nirbhar Yojana portal. New User RegistrationSelect the "Login" option.Subsequently, click on the "Register Here" link.Complete the registration form with the requisite details, including your name, Aadhaar card number, email ID, and mobile number.Establish a password for your account.Upon successful registration, the applicant will receive a User ID and password.Login & Application Process:﻿Log in using the provided User ID and password to access the application form.Fill in the complete application form.Upload the required documents, including a photograph, caste certificate, residential certificate, and land ownership proof, etc.Submit the application form.
documents_required: ST CertificateDomicile Certificate/Permanent Resident Certificate (PRC)Photocopy of 1st page of Bank Passbook Any other document if required
frequently_asked_questions: Who can apply for ANPPY?Unemployed APST individuals, SHGs, farmers clubs, and registered cooperative societies can apply.What are the eligible livestock units under the scheme?Dairy, poultry, and piggery units are eligible.Is the scheme loan-based?Yes, ANPPY is a credit-linked scheme requiring bank loan sanction.Do SHGs need to be registered to apply?Yes, SHGs must be promoted by ArSRLM and properly registered.What documents are needed to apply?Documents include Aadhaar, APST certificate, unemployment proof, and a project proposal.How soon will I get the subsidy?Subsidy is released post-loan sanction and verification by the department.Will training or support be provided?Yes, technical support and guidance will be provided by the implementing agency.Can existing livestock businesses apply?No, the scheme is intended for new, unemployed applicants only.Where can I apply for the scheme?Applicant can apply at the Atma Nirbhar Yojana portal.
sources_and_references:
Guidelines: https://cdn.s3waas.gov.in/s3c0c7c76d30bd3dcaefc96f40275bdc0a/uploads/2023/02/2023020361.pdf
Application Portal: https://agri.arunachal.gov.in/atmanirbhar_yojana/
Official Website: https://ahvdd.arunachal.gov.in/index.html

title: Fodder Development Scheme For Gram Panchayat, Gaushala And Panjarpol Having Gauchar Land
details: The "Fodder Development Scheme For Gram Panchayat, Gaushala And Panjarpol Having Gauchar Land" launched by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat, aims to improve the fertility and productivity of gauchar land by supporting activities like removal of weeds, ploughing, sowing of fodder seeds, and fencing. By enhancing the availability of green fodder, the scheme not only boosts milk production and cattle health but also improves the rural environment and creates employment.
benefits: ﻿ComponentStandard of AssistanceMinimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming Constituent BenefitsFodder Development Scheme for Gram Panchayat, Gaushala and Panjarapol having gauchar land	For developing cow pastures in an area of up to 20 hectares are assisted with 75% of per hectare expenditure up to a maximum of ₹75,000/- i.e. A maximum assistance of ₹15,00,000/- for a total of 20 hectares.The benefit of this scheme will be available only once.﻿
eligibility: Village panchayats having land for gauchar, gaushala and panjrapoles Gauchar, gaushala and panjrapoles must be registered under the Public Charity Act.
application_process: OfflineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Animal Husbandry Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the online application and submit it to the board within 30 days of application with the signature and stamp of the GGVB’s nodal officer of the concerned district with the necessary documents listed in the application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.﻿
documents_required: 7/12 extract, 8-A extract, 6-rights record.GPS photos of gauchar land with date/time.Project map and cost estimation (as per S.O.R.).Surveyor's certificate of land measurement.Any other documents as required.
frequently_asked_questions: What is the primary aim of the "Fodder Development Scheme For Gram Panchayat, Gaushala And Panjarpol Having Gauchar Land"?The main objective of the scheme is to develop fodder and pasture land in gauchar areas to address fodder scarcity and improve land fertility.Who are the entities eligible to benefit from this fodder development scheme?Village Panchayats having land for gauchar, as well as Gaushalas and Panjarapols registered under the Public Charity Act that also possess land for gauchar, are eligible to apply for this scheme.What kind of financial assistance is provided under this scheme for fodder development?The scheme provides assistance of 75% of the per hectare expenditure, up to a maximum of ₹75,000/- per hectare, for developing cow pastures in an area of up to 20 hectares, with a maximum total assistance of ₹15,00,000/-.Is there a limit to the total land area for which an entity can receive assistance under this scheme?Yes, assistance is provided for developing cow pastures in a gauchar area of up to a maximum of 20 hectares per eligible entity.Can an eligible entity avail the benefits of this scheme multiple times?No, the benefit of this Fodder Development Scheme for Gram Panchayat, Gaushala And Panjarapol Having Gauchar Land will be available only once to each eligible entity.What are some of the activities that are supported under this Fodder Development Scheme?The scheme supports activities such as the removal of acacia and weeds from the gauchar land, ploughing, sowing of fodder seeds, and the installation of wire fencing around the land area to be reformed.Does this scheme have any impact on rural employment opportunities?Yes, the activities involved in fodder development under this scheme, such as land preparation, sowing, and fencing, can provide employment opportunities in rural areas.What is the procedure for Gram Panchayats to apply for this fodder development scheme?Gram Panchayats need to apply online through the i-Khedut portal, obtain the necessary signatures and stamps, attach required documents including a Gram Sabha resolution and the appointment of a Gauchar Gram Samiti, and submit them to the board within 30 days.What specific documents related to the Gauchar land are required during the application process?Applicants need to submit copies of the 7/12, 8-A, and 6-right sheet of the Gauchar land, along with GPS map app photos showing the date and time, and GPS Map App camera photographs of the specific survey number land intended for development.Is it mandatory to provide a surveyor's certificate for the land measurement?Yes, the applying organization must provide a certificate from a government-approved or registered surveyor confirming the land measurement of the area proposed for gauchar development.

title: Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries: Scheme For Fish Sale Equipment - Gujarat
details: The scheme "Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries with the component scheme for Fish Sale Equipments, Gujarat" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to increase fish production and provide employment to Scheduled Caste (SC) individuals engaged in inland fisheries. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided for purchasing fish sale equipment to SC fish farmers and fishermen. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries, Government of Gujarat.Objectives:To increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to scheduled caste (SC) people involved in inland fisheries activities.To boost fish farming or fishing activities in freshwater bodies by scheduled caste (SC) fish farmers and fishermen.Fishing in reservoirs, aquaculture in ponds, and catch from rivers increase fish production and boost inland fisheries through scheduled caste (SC) fish farmers and fishermen.The main objective is to provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Caste fishermen in the state and increase fish production.﻿
benefits: Assistance is provided at 50% of the total unit purchase cost of ₹15,000/-, which amounts to ₹7,500/-. This assistance covers four components: An insulated box (₹1,000/-), A box (₹500/-), A renkadi (₹5,000/-),A weighing unit (₹1,000/-).﻿Frequency of Disbursement: This benefit can be availed once in a lifetime.﻿
eligibility: The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) community.The applicant should be above 18 years of age.The applicant should be involved in inland fisheries activities.The applicant can be an individual, a society, a self-help group, an association, a reservoir monopoly, or a private unit.The applicant must have a bank account in their own name.The applicant must have an Aadhar Card/Voter ID/Ration Card/Passport as proof of identity.﻿Preference/Reservation:The scheme specifically benefits Scheduled Caste fishermen under the inland fisheries scheme.﻿
application_process: OnlineRegistration Process:Step 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at the I-Khedut Portal.Step 2: Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side, then click on "Beneficiary Registration" and select any one from the 'Farmer' or 'Institutional' or 'Except For the Farmer' as the Beneficiary Type.Step 3: Enter the 'Company Name' and Address if you have selected 'Institutional' or 'Except For the Farmer' as the Beneficiary Type. And for all select the District, Taluka, and Village, choose 'what type of account holder you are?', enter your Account Number and Name, solve the Captcha, and click 'Save and Next'.Step 4: Enter your Mobile Number and E-mail address, click 'Send OTP', enter the received OTP, create and confirm a Password, solve the Captcha, and click 'Submit'.Login Process: Step 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at the I-Khedut Portal.Step 2: Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side of the homepage. On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button, and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on the "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a printout of the confirmed application.﻿Contact Us: Click here.﻿
documents_required: Aadhar Card/Voter ID/Ration Card/Passport (as proof of identity)Bank Account PassbookScheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Certificate﻿
frequently_asked_questions: Who is eligible to receive assistance for purchasing fish sale equipment?Only individuals from the Scheduled Caste community involved in inland fisheries activities are eligible to receive assistance for fish sale equipment.﻿Can a private fisheries unit apply for this benefit?Yes, private units involved in inland fisheries activities can apply for this benefit.﻿I am part of a self-help group working in fisheries. Can we avail this assistance?Yes, self-help groups involved in inland fisheries activities are eligible to apply for the benefit.﻿Is there any age limit to apply for assistance?Yes, the applicant must be above 18 years of age to be eligible for the scheme.﻿How many times can one apply for this benefit?This assistance can be availed only once in a lifetime by each beneficiary.﻿Can this benefit be availed without a bank account?No, the beneficiary must have a bank account to receive the financial assistance.﻿Where can I apply for this assistance?Applications must be submitted online through the iKhedut portal at https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in.﻿Does the scheme focus on any specific type of fishing?The scheme is focused on inland fisheries activities, including fishing in reservoirs, aquaculture in ponds, and catching fish from rivers.﻿How can I track my application status after applying?You can check the status of your application by logging into the iKhedut portal with your registered credentials.﻿

title: Intensive Fisheries Development Programme - Subsidy on Purchase of Fishing Nets (Scheduled Caste)
details: The "Subsidy on Purchase of Fishing Nets" is a scheme component under the Intensive Fisheries Development Programme, introduced by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to individuals from Scheduled Caste families engaged in fishing activities for the purchase of fishing nets. Under this scheme, eligible beneficiaries can avail a subsidy of up to 60% on the cost of fishing nets.
benefits: Financial Assistance is provided to Fish Farmers under the scheme: Financial assistance of 60% subsidy on the purchase of fishing nets of amounting to ₹40,000/-.The maximum subsidy amount is ₹24,000/-.Note: Subsidy is available only once in two years per beneficiary.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.The applicant should possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category.The applicant should be at least 18 years old.The applicant should present a GST-paid bill for the purchase of fishing nets.The applicant can apply only once in two years for this subsidy.

Click on ‘Submit’.Step 3: Verify the OTP received in the provided Email and Mobile Number. documents_required: Agreement Letter-1 (Agreement letter between the farmer and the department for fisheries)Birth Certificate (Date of birth certificate / Class ten (10th) certificate / PAN Card / Voter ID Card / Driver's License)Identity Proof (Ration Card / Aadhaar Card / PAN Card / Voter ID Card)Fisheries Training Certificate of the Applicant from any Government InstitutionCaste Certificate (issued by a First-Class Magistrate)GST Payment Bill/Receipt for Fishnet Purchase
frequently_asked_questions: What is the maximum subsidy amount offered?₹24,000 on a fishing net purchase worth ₹40,000.Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?SC category residents of Haryana aged 18 years or above.Is this scheme available to General Category applicants?No, it is exclusively for Scheduled Caste beneficiaries.What is the frequency of this subsidy?Once in two years per eligible applicant.What documents are needed for proof of identity and age?Aadhaar, PAN, Voter ID, or Driving License.What is the application fee?₹10 service charge and ₹10 Atal Seva Kendra charge; no government fee.Where can I apply for this scheme?The applicant can apply through the Atal Seva Kendra or the Antyodaya SARAL portal.What kind of invoice is acceptable?Only GST-paid purchase invoice/receipt for fishing nets.
